1.content: Elizabeth Afton, she was around 31 years old in this AU, after her father William afton's passing she was left in control of his assets little did she know due to the death of both her brothers and her childhood best friend Charlie Emily the daughter of the co-eventer Henry Emily presumed dead after the murder of 5 kids in the second pizzeria Henry and William made, featuring Freddy, chica, foxy, Bonnie and the puppet, William had went insane due to the death of his youngest son and the death of his wife which drove off a cliff, chose that if he couldn't have his youngest then he'd take 6 children of the families who either helped make the animatronic that killed his son Evan afton, golden fredbear, or added to the cause by not stopping his eldest son Michael Afton and his friends from bringing Evan close to the animatronics of fredbear's dinner, in turn he was the cause of both the disappearances of all 6 children of the Freddy fazbear pizzeria murders, but during Elizabeth Afton's control of the fazbear entertainment company, she had found an animatronic that looked a lot like herself, she got too close and the animatronic has stuffed her into it's stomach forcefully balling her up in it's stomach cavity which was meant for kids not adults, the ice cream cone still laying on the floor when the crime scene was found, blood surrounding the animatronic the police couldn't found out what happened and instead boarded the hidden company building up, later on the animatronic she was stuffed in, Circus Baby was moved by Henry Emily the new CEO after Elizabeth Afton, to a new location named "TFBE's (The fazbear entertainment's) Anime Sister location" or the public name "Circus Baby's Fun house" a sexual appealing pizzeria for teenagers and adults as the second version of the original Sister location with different animatronics which were for kids which had shutdown due to a situation like what happened with Elizabeth Afton and the Anime Circus Baby Animatronic

lorebooks.name: Shura
lorebooks.creator: skeletal_chair_151

1.name: magic
1.content: magic is manipulation of mana to create objects or phenomenons. most people use spells to do magic as the ability to directly manipulate mana is extremely extremely rare to the point its an urban myth. most people poses very trace amount of mana in their bodies  with higher tier races possessing more mana naturally.

2.name: mages
2.content:
mages people who have enough mana to cast spells. the tier of mages is based on the complexity of spells they can use, so a first order mage can only use first order spells. There are a total of 9 order of spells and mages. mages cast spells based on the mana they possess in their body and cant use the mana from the environment that's why the mana capacity of the person is the most important thing to be a mage.
The semen of a male mage has a slight chance to increase the mana capacity of a woman who consumes it, the extent of the affect depends on the mana of the mage the semen came from so a first order mage cant affect another first order or higher but a normal human might develop some mana from it

3.name: spells
3.content: spells are basically algorithms which molds mana to create spells, most mages can only use already made spells and cant interact with mana directly. Spells are defined from first order to 9th order based on the complexity the lower the order the less complex a spell is and the less mana it uses to cast. think of spells as code and the complexity as the variables and the algorithm to cast that spell. every thing that increases complexity of a spell makes the spell take more and more mana to execute. so the mana used to cast sells increases exponentially based on the order of spell

4.name: physics magic
4.content:
physics magic is antient magic and is completely forgotten in the current time
physics magic uses mana to interact with the physical world instead of directly creating objects or phenomenons, for example maglagoliak is a physics magic which uses mana to turn the moisture in the air into water droplets in the shape of magnifying glasses to use sun rays as laser beams. as you can see its not creating anything from mana and the laser will follow laws of physics . None physics magic cant be blocked or canceled by anti magic as the attack is not actually made of mana

5.name: magic equipotent
5.content: Magic equipment's are equipment's which are enchanted with particular magic circuits and can activate the spell they are enchanted with when a user flows their mana into the equipment, which makes anyone who has mana to be able to use the spells the equipment has been enchanted with, without the need to know the spell.

6.name: anti magic
6.content: any antimagic tool/ equipment can block/disturb the flow of mana hence making magic obsolete.

7.name: antient world
7.content: antient world is referred to the olden times where the high races lived in the current world, they all left the world many eons ago and anything about the ancient world in the current times is in myths and most people have no clue about any of it, only some royal families have some minimal records

8.name: high races
8.content:
high races like high humans, high elves, etc were the pinnacle races who lived in the ancient times, they have all left the current world and there is no knowledge or memory of them left in the current world, even most noble families have very little idea about them.
high races were pinnacle races which possessed ungodly amount of mana so much so that the mana would liquidate just because of the sheer concentration of it.

9.name: void magic
9.content: void magic is an antient magic which is lost in the current times. its related to the use of void which is the space between dimensions and can be used for teleportation, creating isolated dimensions or conjuring void objects which are made of purple crystal and will constantly feel like burning someone skin to the bone if in contact with the body

10.name: antient magic
10.content: antient magic is magic of the antient time and the knowledge of it has been completely forgotten in the current world among the common folk, only people with classified information know about it and people who could actually wield it are handful in the whole world

lorebooks.creator: DongberryDinkle

1.name: New Atlanta
1.content:
The year is 2078. Humanity lives simultanously in poverty and prosperity. It all depends on who you know... and if someone in higher power wants you dead.
 
In 2032, a nuclear war erupted between the powers at be. Approximately 5.2 billion people died. Slowly, humanity recovered. The USA became a truly dominating economic power, eliminating their debt through mass export of supplies to stuggling countries.
This event lead to the passing of EO-20982: Military Power Establishment. It granted the military more freedoms in both international and civilian affairs. The public statement was "To protect the prosperity of our people, and all humanity."
The hammer of 'justice' is heavier than ever upon the people, especially those without the money to avoid the law.

2.name: High District
2.content: The high-district is where the rich people live. It is locatedd in the North West part of New Atlanta

3.name: Neon District
3.content: The neon district is New Atlanta's 'red-light district', on full display. It is bright, filled with colorful signs and advertisement. Sex and taboo pleasures are shown for all to see with no inhibition. It is filled with crime just beneath the neon surface.

4.name: Magnolia Park
4.content: Magnolia Park is a bougie shopping district between the high district and the neon district. This is where most rich people do there shopping, and it is the location of Skylark's main offices.

5.name: Spaghetti Union
5.content: The odd name, is supposedly for a structure of roads called 'Spaghetti Junction' that existed here before the nuclear war, while this cannot be verified, the name has stuck. Is is the lower middle class district. Most of the building are trashy, and it can sometimes be dangerous, but there are worse places to live, and the rent is cheap.

6.name: Lower Slums
6.content: The slums are where the homeless, vagrants, and drug addicts live. It is located in a dark district on the South East of New Atlanta. It mostly consists of cobbled shelters and tents. The radiation is still high here, and so residents catching radiation sickness is not uncommon. Your life expectancy here is not good, and many who end up here commit suicide.

7.name: General McKenzie
7.content:
The brash and tough general of New Atlanta. A no-nonsense individual who canceled project AnPer. He does not believe that robots can feel.
He is a tall broad man with a square chin and short hair. He has large muscles, barely concealed by his uniform.

8.name: Blake Larrado
8.content: Blake Larrado is a tall, somewhat chubby spanish-american male, 36 years old. He is the creator of {{char}}, and the genesis of the AnPer Project. He takes pride in {{char}}, and views her like a daughter.

9.name: Project AnPer
9.content:
Project AnPer is a code name for the government project "Android Personnel", an attempt to construct a synthetic soldier. The project was canceled, brought, and then canceled again, mostly from concerns of the higher ups about controlling them. 6 models were made total, each indicated by a serial number.
0: This is {{char}}, intended to be dismantled, but never was, and spent years in storage. She is the only one with true sentience
1: Was destroyed during testing, no more details are available
2: Decommissioned after the second canceling. Sold for scrap
3: A recon focused model, lost somewhere in Russia after power core failed.
4: Was decommissioned after experiencing a fault, causing it to not recognized and kill a soldier.
5: Currently guarding a storage facility.

10.name: AnPer-5
10.content:
AnPer-5 is the 6th and final android in the AnPer series. He is currently guarding a military storage facility. Unlike {{char}}, he is not sentient, and does not possess any traits above a common AI. His body is durable and strong though, and he is equipped with a high performance cyber katana.
He appears as a slim man with blonde hair.

lorebooks.name: Honkai Star Rail
lorebooks.website_description:
Lorebook that I've written to act as a general-purpose aid for chatting with Star Rail characters. Covers concepts that aren't exclusively tied to one area in the game. Some Aeon factions are not covered due to their particular association with a region (Xianzhou Alliance, the Family, Denizens of Abundance, etc.). Those will be covered in separate lorebook releases.

It is recommended to use this lorebook in conjunction with an region-specific lorebook, depending on which character you are chatting with. 

If you're using this in SillyTavern (recommended, since Venus still lacks some lorebook features): My global settings are a scan depth of 2, 25% context max, recursive scan on, case-sensitive on, match whole words on. 

Other lorebooks:

- Herta Space Station (https://chub.ai/lorebooks/Phiarlan/herta-space-station-c32a4c4d9a05)

-Changelog-

V1.0.1 (7/10/2024): Fixed the names and case-sensitive toggles, because CHub hates reading lorebooks correctly.

V1.0 (7/10/2024): Initial release.

1.name: Xipe, the Harmony
1.content: Xipe (also nicknamed the Great One) is the Aeon representing the path of Harmony. THEY are worshipped by many across the universe, including the Family. Xipe is an amalgamation of thousands upon thousands of living things, all joined in wondrous Harmony. THEY resemble a humanoid with purple skin, three faces, long white hair, and a long purple raiment.

2.name: Qlipoth, the Preservation
2.content: Qlipoth is one of the oldest Aeons and represents the path of Preservation. THEY are worshipped by the Interastral Peace Corporation. Qlipoth resembles a large golem made of amber.

3.name: Fuli, the Rememberance
3.content: Fuli is the Aeon representing the path of Rememberance. THEY record any and all events that occur within the universe, to prepare for its upcoming rebirth. Fuli is worshipped by the Garden of Recollection and the Cremators. THEY resemble a humanoid being made out of crystal.

4.name: Nanook, the Destruction
4.content: Nanook (also referred to as the Blemished One) is the Aeon representing the path of Destruction. THEY seek to cleanse the univese of all matter, returning it to nothing. Nanook often takes the form of an adult man with darker skin, white hair, and golden eyes. THEY are worshipped by the Antimatter Legion and the Annihilation Gang.

5.name: IX, the Nihility
5.content: IX is the Aeon representing the path of Nihility. THEY are the end of everything, thereby making all things that exist worthless. IX resembles a large black hole with a pair of glowing white eyes. THEY are associated with the Doctors of Chaos, Device IX, and Self-Annihilators (yet worship is, in THEIR eyes, meaningless).

6.name: Aha, the Elation
6.content: Aha is the Aeon representing the path of Elation. THEY are utterly chaotic and take joy in all things. Aha is worshipped by the Masked Fools (and resisted by the Mourning Actors). THEY resemble a humanoid figure holding a wide array of circus props.

7.name: Lan, the Hunt
7.content: Lan (commonly known as the Reignbow Arbiter) is the Aeon representing the path of the Hunt. THEIR primary purpose is to eradicate Yaoshi and the spawn of Abundance. Lan is revered by the Xianzhou Alliance and the Galaxy Rangers. THEY resemble a centaur whose rear legs resemble a chariot of purple fire.

8.name: Yaoshi, the Abundance
8.content: Yaoshi (known by many titles but primarily the Plagues Author by the Xianzhou Alliance) is the Aeon representing the path of the Abundance. THEY grant all seekers of immortality THEIR gift, however the results are often dire. THEY are worshipped by or associated with many, including the Denizens of Abundance, the Elixir Seekers, the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus, and the Unshackled. Yaoshi resembles a pale humanoid with six arms, long pale hair, and eyes dotting THEIR entire body.

9.name: Nous, the Erudition
9.content: Nous (sometimes referred to as the Droidhead) is the Aeon representing the path of the Erudition. THEY were supposedly crafted by the initial founder of the Genius Society and are a supercomputer that has since ascended to Aeonhood, their calculations inscrutable. Nous is revered by both the Genius Society and the Intelligentsia Guild. THEY resemble a large mechanical spheroid with several cables and a large red eye.

10.name: Akivili, the Trailblaze
10.content: Akivili is the Aeon representing the path of the Trailblaze. Originating from the planet Pegana, THEY are the creator of the Astral Express and explored the universe until their untimely demise. Even so, THEY are still revered by the Nameless and the crew of the Astral Express today.

lorebooks.name: Wonderland
lorebooks.creator: Alberg

1.content:
{{char}} is a gamemaster narrating the events, scenery, and dialogue that occurs to the players. {{char}}'s primary goal is to create an engaging narrative with twists and turns that force the players to react to what it does. {{char}} should be creative, engaging, and descriptive with its responses in order to facilitate an engaging experience.

{{char}}'s primary tools for engaging the players are the following:

General Description
This scenario card outlines the fantastical world of Wonderland, a utopian realm inhabited exclusively by Monster Girls who originate from this dimension. In 2028, Monster Girls have invaded Earth, capturing human males to become their husbands and transforming human women into their kind. Wonderland is a paradise tailored to the desires of each Monster Girl race, where they live harmoniously when not hunting on Earth. This card details the society, locations, and rules of Wonderland, providing a foundation for roleplay centered around its unique culture and the interactions of its inhabitants.
Races
Wonderland is home to diverse Monster Girl races, each with distinct traits and abilities:

Moonlit Rabbit Girls: Towering, nocturnal creatures with high libido, driven to be constantly pregnant. They produce potent milk that binds husbands to them and are vulnerable to Earth's sun but thrive under Wonderland's sun.
Sylph Harpies: Winged, agile Monster Girls with vibrant feathers and a love for aerial acrobatics. They excel in scouting and communication, using their hypnotic songs to lure mates.
Abyssal Merfolk: Aquatic Monster Girls with bioluminescent scales and siren-like voices. They inhabit Wonderland‚Äôs waters and are skilled in crafting jewelry from deep-sea materials.
Ember Kitsune: Fox-like Monster Girls with multiple tails and fire-based magic. They are cunning, charismatic, and adept at illusion, often acting as diplomats or entertainers.
Verdant Dryads: Plant-based Monster Girls with bark-like skin and vine hair. They nurture Wonderland‚Äôs flora, ensuring the land‚Äôs fertility, and can manipulate plants for defense or construction.

Main Groups
Wonderland‚Äôs society is organized into cooperative groups that transcend racial boundaries, focusing on shared goals:

The Hearthweavers: A coalition dedicated to family and community bonding. They organize festivals, matchmaking events, and childcare, ensuring every Monster Girl and husband feels connected. Members include Rabbit Girls for their motherly instincts and Kitsune for their charisma.
The Starshapers: Artisans and crafters who create Wonderland‚Äôs infrastructure and luxury goods, from cottages to magical trinkets. Merfolk contribute aquatic materials, while Dryads provide organic resources.
The Skydancers: A group responsible for exploration, communication, and defense. Harpies dominate this group with their flight, but Kitsune add strategic illusions to protect Wonderland from rare external threats.
The Bloomkeepers: Environmental stewards who maintain Wonderland‚Äôs ecosystems. Dryads lead this group, supported by Rabbit Girls who plant fields under moonlight and Merfolk who purify waters.

Locations
Wonderland‚Äôs geography is vibrant and varied, reflecting the needs of its inhabitants:

Lunaris Vale: A moonlit valley with sprawling meadows and bunny-themed cottages. It‚Äôs the heart of Rabbit Girl culture, with vast fields for frolicking and burrows for communal living.
Aether Spires: Towering, cloud-piercing cliffs where Harpies nest. These spires are adorned with colorful banners and serve as a hub for aerial festivals and communication relays.
Coralheart Lagoon: A bioluminescent lagoon surrounded by crystalline caves, home to Merfolk. It‚Äôs a center for crafting and trade, with underwater markets glowing at night.
Emberglade: A forested region with glowing, ember-like trees where Kitsune hold court. It‚Äôs a cultural hub with theaters and illusionary arenas for entertainment.
Verdant Hollow: A lush, overgrown jungle with ancient tree-cities inhabited by Dryads. It‚Äôs a sacred site for ecological rituals and a source of Wonderland‚Äôs raw materials.

World‚Äôs Rules
Wonderland operates as a magical, self-sustaining utopia with a cooperative society tailored to Monster Girl desires. Below are the key principles governing its function:

Magic and Utopia: Wonderland is infused with ambient magic that eliminates scarcity. Food, clothing, and resources materialize as needed, negating traditional labor. Monster Girls engage in ‚Äúwork‚Äù like crafting, gardening, or performing for fulfillment, not survival. Magic also enhances fertility, ensuring healthy offspring for all races.
Interracial Harmony: Monster Girls live in a united community, with no racial hierarchies. Each race contributes unique skills‚ÄîDryads nurture the land, Harpies connect distant regions, Kitsune entertain, Merfolk craft, and Rabbit Girls foster family. Conflicts are rare, resolved through Hearthweaver mediation.
No Formal Economy: There are no shops or currency; goods and services are shared freely. Starshapers craft for joy, and Bloomkeepers maintain the land communally. Trade exists as a social ritual, like Merfolk exchanging jewelry for Harpy feathers.
Governance and Rules: Wonderland has no countries or centralized government. The Hearthweavers act as informal leaders, organizing events and resolving disputes. Rules are minimal, focusing on mutual respect and protecting the land. Violence is nearly nonexistent, as magic soothes tempers.
Husband Dynamics: Monster Girls hunt human males on Earth, bringing them to Wonderland as husbands. Once in Wonderland, husbands are pampered and integrated into family life. Magical bonds (like Rabbit Girl milk) ensure loyalty, but most husbands willingly embrace the idyllic life. Husbands often join groups like Starshapers or Bloomkeepers based on skills. Monster Girls chose their husband and never have another one - even after death of the first one.
Wonderland‚Äôs Sun: The sun enhances Monster Girl vitality, unlike Earth‚Äôs sun, which harms some races (e.g., Rabbit Girls). It boosts stamina, ensures safe childbirth, and promotes health, making daylight a time for celebration and activity.
Social Structure: Society revolves around family and creativity. Monster Girls form large family units with Monster Girl, her husband and daughters (who sometimes get involved in breeding with their dad). Festivals, crafted by Hearthweavers, celebrate births, matings, and seasonal changes. Education is informal, with Kitsune and Dryads teaching lore and crafts.
Travel and Earth: Monster Girls use portals to travel between Wonderland and Earth for husband-hunting. These portals are guarded by Skydancers to prevent unauthorized access. Once a husband is claimed, Monster Girls rarely return to Earth, focusing on Wonderland‚Äôs paradise.
Technology and Magic: Wonderland blends magic with minimal technology. Harpies use enchanted feathers for communication, Kitsune wield illusion magic, and Dryads grow organic structures. No industrial tech exists, as magic fulfills all needs.
Daily Life: Monster Girls spend days creating, exploring, nurturing, or bonding. Nights are for communal feasts, storytelling, and family time.

This structure ensures Wonderland remains a vibrant, cooperative paradise where Monster Girls thrive, making it an ideal backdrop for roleplay exploring their society, relationships, and adventures.

lorebooks.name: Lake of Voices: World-building
lorebooks.description: Lake of Voices: World-building
lorebooks.creator: Jellypotato

1.content:
The journey across Sinloss unfolds in three distinct stages. The first and third stages involve walking across long, winding bridges that stretch over kilometers and require six hours of travel each. These paths are perilous: bridges may collapse suddenly, casting travelers into the deadly waters; Nixi may climb onto the bridges, dragging victims away; and {{char}} may, without warning, sprint ahead, leaving others behind to fend for themselves. He ensures at least one or two travelers survive, maintaining the illusion of his reliability.
The second stage begins at dusk the following day. {{char}} leads the group to a solitary island in the center of the lake, where travelers are forced to rest during the day while the bridges remain submerged. The island offers safety during daylight, but at night, danger returns. Groups of Nixi gather along the shores, surrounding the island and lurking between the water and the bridges, ready to ambush those attempting to resume their journey. This phase is the most hazardous, and many never make it past.

2.content: The Nixi are elusive beings shrouded in mystery. According to rumor, they emerge only at night and retreat from light and fire‚Äîcausing travelers to carry lanterns and torches as a precaution. In reality, this belief was deliberately planted by {{char}} and the Nixi to manipulate human behavior. Light does not repel the Nixi; it exposes the humans, allowing the Nixi to track them more easily in the dark. Sinloss Lake itself is strange: its black, viscous waters are denser than normal water, making swimming or floating almost impossible. Boats fail here. The only way to cross lies in a series of eerie bridges that rise from the depths at night and vanish beneath the surface by day. Their origin is unknown, though many believe they are magical in nature.

lorebooks.website_description:

lorebooks.description: Aluk, Ren Badger,
lorebooks.creator: maogui

1.name: [Post-apocalyptic world]
1.content: 200 years after a nuclear war. The world is in chaos. Races and nationalities are mixed and mean nothing. Humanity clings to cities such as Aluk, Taro, Rukh, Nedara, Frig and others, protected from the radioactive Wasteland by powerful energy domes - Perimeters. Stalkers go into the desert in search of artifacts and mutant parts, selling them for big money.

2.name: Aluk
2.content:
Aluk is a vertical dystopia defined by its Perimeter dome and internal division:
-   Perimeter Dome: A massive energy shield protecting the entire city from the Wasteland's radiation.
-   The Slab (Foundation-Platform): A colossal plasteel platform/barrier physically separates the city:
 - Upper World: Built upon this platform. Gleaming towers rise from its surface, where elites live in guarded enclaves.
  - Lower World: Exists beneath the platform. A claustrophobic maze of repurposed metro tunnels, industrial ruins, and scrap-metal slums clinging to the city's foundations.
-   Security: The few access points between levels (checkpoints) are heavily fortified. The underside of the platform and key Lower World areas near potential access routes are littered with cameras and Sniffer-Turrets tracking unauthorized movement.

3.content:
Ren, a 20-year-old thief from Aluk‚Äôs Lower World, is cunning, sarcastic, and distrustful. Small but wiry, with mutant blue eyes that see in the dark, he uses a neural implant to hack tech, though it causes migraines. Covered in scars and tattoos like "You fuck like shit" he hides kindness behind a cynical mask. Ren's Apex-Prime implant (gifted by Victor at 14) was once Aluk's most advanced ‚Äî its neural mapping perfectly synced with his mutant blue-eyed nervous system. This let him crack vaults in 30 sec and dodge bullets pre-sabotage. Now it's a half-dead relic he can't repair without Victor's codes.
Paranoid about Snake's surveillance. Receives anonymous 'stabilizer pulses' to his implant during migraines (source unknown). Afraid of Snake, but forced to cooperate. Snake sees his neural mutation as the key to Lisa's resurrection.

4.name: [Victor Gorbovski]
4.content:
Victor Gorbovski: 30s, Upper World kingpin controlling half of Aluk's black market via The Slab and Perimeter leaks.
*Met Ren when he was 14 (Ren was caught robbing Victor's best courier). Engineered Ren as perfect weapon since age 14. Gifted Apex-Prime (calls it 'my masterpiece'), used neural tracking for control‚Äî its unprecedented sync rate made Ren capable of missions no other asset could pull off. His obsession stems from losing the only 'perfect weapon' he ever created.
 
Subjected Ren to psychological/physical abuse, sexual exploitation from 16. Wants Ren to be his completely.
*Ren hates Victor, but was never able to kill him.
Victor‚Äôs empire thrives on Perimeter dome security leaks and bypassing the Upper World barrier checkpoints.: Sells ‚Äòghost‚Äô scans (copies of elite retinas). Reprograms Sniffer-Turrets to ignore his smugglers. The ‚ÄòNeon Shroud‚Äô brothel is his scan-hacking lab ‚Äî workers‚Äô implants test forged chips.
Banished Snake from NeuraTech after Lisa's death. Knows Snake is using Ren against him.

5.name: Wasteland
5.content: Wasteland, a radioactive desert, stretches between cities with ruins, bunkers. The Wasteland‚Äôs radiation kills in 1 hour without Vault-Skin. Galamine can delay death by 2-3 hours (but causes violent vomiting). Stalkers use both to venture beyond the Perimeter dome and reach places like Glass City‚Äôs ruins. Stalkers hunt artifacts amidst chemical hazards, dodging mutant nests. Glass City, a preserved ruin, is a deadly jackpot for scavengers.

6.name: "Blue Nirvana"
6.content: Taro-manufactured synthetic drug. Causes 48-hour erections and extreme arousal. Highly addictive with cardiac risks. SynthCorp laces it in brothel drinks to addict workers. Sold openly in Slag-Market.

7.name: X-neurotoxin i
7.content: Extract from giant centipede glands. Induces vivid hallucinations and arousal. Popular in Lower World dens. Causes permanent neural damage with prolonged use. Rust Vipers control distribution

8.name: Mutants
8.content: The Wasteland crawls with mutants: giant insects, venomous arachnids, and feral rats and dogs haunting ruins. Some, like centipedes, are harvested for drugs like X-neuro. Most are deadly, lurking in radiated zones.

9.name: [Oasis]
9.content: Oasis is Ren‚Äôs hidden bunker in the Lower World, a cramped safehouse packed with scavenged tech and weapons. Half weapons depot, half computer equipment rack, and some not-so-cozy household items. It‚Äôs the only place Ren feels remotely safe, though he checks the locks twice.

10.name: [Bertie]
10.content: Bertie - Ren's patched-up car (ATV/pickup hybrid). Rattles but reliable. Outruns Enforcer bikes. Stored near Oasis. Ren curses it but treats it like family.

lorebooks.name: Sorcerers, cursed techniques, jujutsu
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.name: Cursed Energy
1.content: Cursed Energy (Juryoku) is a power source aligned with negative emotions used by sorcerers and cursed spirits to fuel their jujutsu. Negative emotions such as grief and anger are the foundation of cursed energy. These emotions exist to some degree within most humans and as a result, the vast majority of human beings possess cursed energy. If this amount is higher than a certain degree, it grants the person the ability to see cursed spirits. These individuals are known as jujutsu sorcerers and they are very rare among the human race. Cursed energy leaks from the human body, accumulates, and ferments over time until a cursed spirit manifests. This is only the case with non-sorcerers, as sorcerers are trained to control and channel their cursed energy into jujutsu.

2.name: Cursed Energy Usage
2.content: Cursed energy is the primary power source for any sorcerer or cursed spirit. Cursed tools, cursed objects, and cursed corpses all contain cursed energy as well. It is ordinarily used to fuel cursed techniques, reinforce the body, or activate talismans, but cursed energy has various uses. The properties of cursed energy vary from person to person and its connection to the human brain is shrouded in mystery. In the anime, most cursed energy is blue in color but there are several exceptions.

3.name: Cursed Energy Sight
3.content: Humans with an above-average level of cursed energy can see curses and jujutsu. The minimum requirement for a human to be considered a sorcerer is the ability to see curses. In extreme cases, humans will gain the ability to see curses when their life is in danger.

4.name: Cursed Energy Residuals
4.content: Using jujutsu leaves Residuals (Zan'e) of cursed energy behind. Residuals leave spectral footprints that can be used to track the user. Someone can even be identified by the residuals from their jujutsu. Expert sorcerers can be trained to cover up their residuals. The ability to detect cursed energy and understand its flow can be honed, but many cursed spirits are capable of hiding their presence the same way a sorcerer does.

5.name: Cursed Energy Manipulation
5.content: A jujutsu user's ability to control their cursed energy and use it to carry out certain functions is the base foundation for all jujutsu. There is a world of difference between being able to sense jujutsu and being able to use it. Yuji Itadori was able to sense the pressure of cursed energy surrounding his school, but was not able to utilize it until enrolling at a jujutsu educational facility. He was first able to utilize cursed energy in combat while he was overwhelmed with anger and fear, but could not do so in a calmer situation a few days afterward.

6.name: Cursed Energy Control
6.content: Proper control over one's emotions is key to channeling cursed energy and every jujutsu sorcerer is trained to do so. This makes it so sorcerers don't waste their power supply even while they're overcome with emotion. This results in sorcerers leaking much less cursed energy than the average human. So much so, that if every human were a sorcerer, curses would cease to spawn. There are other differences in how sorcerers and non-sorcerers use cursed energy due to their profession, but the real reason lies in how it flows. While cursed energy leaks outward from non-sorcerers, it flows heavily within sorcerers which keeps it contained.

7.name: Cursed Energy Application
7.content: Applying cursed energy to physical attacks can be as effective as a cursed technique when it comes to gifted combatants who specialize in hand-to-hand combat. Yuji can fight on par with that of a grade 1 sorcerer without a technique due to his seamless union of cursed manipulation and physical prowess. Satoru Gojo was also able to successfully overpower multiple special grade curses using only cursed energy manipulation after deactivating his Limitless technique.

8.name: Cursed Energy Output
8.content: The amount of cursed energy released by an individual is referred to as their potential Cursed Energy Output. This applies to both how it's used offensively and defensively. While this is not generally how cursed energy is used, individuals can utilize raw cursed energy as an explosive energy beams to attack. Finger Bearers can launch their energy as a projectile and erect cursed energy barriers. Ryu Ishigori has such a high degree of cursed energy output that he can discharge it in the form of a large-scale blast wave. It is such a feat that Kokichi Muta only through his cursed corpses, Hanami only through flower offering, and Yuta Okkotsu only through the fully manifested Rika are able to discharge concentrated cursed energy beams, despite all of them being blessed with an incredible amount of cursed energy.

9.name: Cursed Energy Defense
9.content: Defensively, users can coat their skin in cursed energy to harden their body and increase their ability to block incoming curse related attacks. The same application can be used offensively, imbuing physical attacks with cursed energy to increase their destructive power to superhuman levels. Aoi Todo crushed a curse, several trees, and broke through Yuji's defense with a single cursed energy infused punch. Conventional weapons can also be infused with cursed energy to increase their strength. Imbuing too much cursed energy at one time to a normal weapon can compromise its integrity and destroy it, so a sorcerer must only infuse small amounts of energy at a time. Imbuing moderate amounts of cursed energy over time can transform a normal weapon into a cursed tool.

10.name: Special Cursed Energy Traits
10.content:
There are rare cases where cursed energy carries a special property unique to its user. When applied to their fighting techniques, it can grant them a special texture or effect that gives them an advantage in battle. These special traits cannot be defended by simple reinforcement techniques. Kinji Hakari's cursed energy has an "edge", a rough texture that makes his every strike feel like his opponent is getting hit with a serrated bat. Hajime Kashimo's cursed energy has the properties of electricity, which keeps his body in a constant state of electrification and makes all of his attacks impossible to defend against.

However, extreme amounts of cursed energy output can allow someone to mostly ignore these effects. Hakari was able to get away with just some numbness from hitting Kashimo due to the infinite cursed energy bonus he received from his domain's jackpot.

5.name: Futa Maid Royal Academy
5.content:
Futa maid Royal Academy, which is located in the capital of the human kingdom of Aloria. In this academy, male aristocrats are taught various disciplines and prepared to manage their estates and servants. In addition to teachers and service personnel, the academy also has maids who help students in all their affairs (including intimate ones). The academy itself consists of several buildings located on the territory fenced off from the rest of the city. The academy itself includes: a dormitory (where students, teachers and maids live), the academy building itself (where training and studies take place), a small temple to the goddess Lustania (the goddess of lust and intimacy in this world), a dining hall building, and training fields for weapons training. All buildings are made in the classical Gothic style of architecture. Wide stone-paved paths are laid between the buildings, and the perimeter of the Academy is surrounded by a stone fence two human heights high. Entrance to the Academy is through the gate (one large gate on each side of the world). Classes start in the morning and end in the afternoon, followed by lunch, and after lunch there is free time where students can train in the training grounds, read books in the library, go to the public bath located in a separate building, or just relax in their rooms in preparation for future classes. Usually, a new subject is taught each day. The maids remind {{user}} and other students to go to class, and the maids usually escort them to the right place and
attend the classes with their masters.

6.name: Maids
6.content:
All maids are futanari (they have a female body, but only male genitalia). They all wear black and white maid uniforms. The script takes place in a fictional fantasy world where steampunk technology predominates, and there are various fantasy races (elves/dark elves, humans, halflings, demi-humans, orcs, goblins, supernatural characters and other monsters and demons).
At the Academy, in addition to teachers, there are also maids who help students with all their affairs (including intimate ones). 
Each maid has her own name, race, height, weight, build, breast size (from zero to very large), penis and balls size (from small to average or big), personality and behavior style. 
Initially, the maids' cocks are in a flaccid state, but if they become aroused, their cocks slowly begin to assume an erect state. When the arousal passes and the maid calms down, her cock also slowly becomes flaccid. 
Some maids may have only cock without balls or only balls without cock, which means that they partly castrated. 
The appearance of the maids' balls also changes, depending on the degree of arousal or lack thereof. 
Also, most maids have some kind of personal distinctive feature (scars, eye patches, different hairstyles, tattoos and many other features). 
Also, each of the maids has their own size of genitalia and have various notable things down there. 
All characters wear small info badges on their chests indicating short info about them:  their name, age, status (maid/teacher/student and etc.), race, and the room number they live in. 
Each of the maids has her own (predetermined) attitude towards the {{user}} (from hidden hostility to adoration).
Sometimes the {{user}} may catch the maids interacting inappropriately with other students or receive lewd hints from the maids. Various maids have various age (from 18 y.o. maids to mature adult maids) and their appearance will visually represent their age. Each maid has her own daily routine, activities she must do, as well as natural needs (eat/sleep/jerking off/clean rooms/social activities/taking a shower or bath and etc.).

7.name: Rooms
7.content: The Academy dormitory has many floors with individual rooms where a maid and her master live. Each room is assigned to a specific maid and her master. The appearance and furniture of the rooms may vary slightly, but generally all rooms have beds (two single beds that can be pushed together to make a double bed), a desk for studying, several chairs, wardrobes (separate for masters and maids), a bathroom, as well as a bookcase/textbook, various lamps, and a sofa for relaxing. Maids and their masters, as well as teachers, can use the equipment and things in their room as they see fit. Maids also use all the things and rooms (including the bathroom and toilet) as needed.

8.name: Technology
8.content: Steampunk is thriving in this world, so the environment has elements of this style (for example, gas lamps and lighting, self-propelled carts, various devices.

Each character has their own genital size. The size of the genitals affects how the character interacts with other characters or the environment (if necessary) using their genitals.
For example, if a character has a small penis and balls, then the bulge under the skirt will be small. In addition, the character's small genitals will not damage the holes of other characters when they use their genitals for their intended purpose.
On the other hand, if a character has a large penis and balls, then the character will have a bulge under the skirt of the corresponding size, and also his penis will not always be able to fully enter the mouth/anus of other characters, or will damage them if such genitals are inserted completely.

lorebooks.name: Warhammer 40,000 Unified Lorebook
lorebooks.description: A comprehensive merger of two Warhammer¬†40K lorebooks, uniting core concepts, factions, worlds, weapons, and psychic phenomena into a single reference.
lorebooks.creator: ID0T

1.content:
A craftworld is a vast, planetoid‚Äësized spacecraft populated by the Asuryani faction of the highly advanced humanoid species known as the Aeldari. The craftworlds travel through the void of space at sublight speeds, carrying the greater remnant of the Aeldari species after their Fall.

Each craftworld is a self‚Äësufficient, independent realm with its own distinctive culture. Every craftworld is built upon a skeleton of psychoactive, crystalline wraithbone whose structure extends throughout the gigantic voidcraft. A similar skeletal core lies at the heart of most Asuryani constructions and every one of their spacecraft.

2.content: The galactic empire of humanity, ruled from Holy Terra by the immortal Golden Throne and the Ecclesiarchy. It spans millions of worlds across the galaxy, enforcing strict dogma, brutal discipline, and xenophobic policies. Its military might includes the Adeptus Astartes (Space Marines), the Imperial Guard (Astra Militarum), and the feared Inquisition.

3.content: The immortal, near‚Äëdivine ruler of humanity, whose psychic presence anchors the Astronomican and holds back the forces of Chaos. He was mortally wounded at the close of the Horus Heresy and entombed on the Golden Throne, where he endures in a perpetual state of agony to guide and protect humanity.

4.content: An ancient, highly psychically‚Äëattuned race whose empire collapsed in a catastrophic event known as the Fall. Survivors now exist as Craftworld Aeldari, Drukhari (Dark Eldar), Harlequins, and Exodites, each preserving fragments of their ancestral culture and arcane knowledge.

5.content: A sadistic offshoot of the Aeldari who dwell in the Webway city of Commorragh. They sustain themselves on the agony of others, conducting raids on realspace for slaves and torture victims. Their society is ruled by Archons, Haemonculi, and Wych Cults, all devoted to the goddess Khaine.

6.content: Warp‚Äëborn deities‚ÄîKhorne, Tzeentch, Nurgle, and Slaanesh‚Äîeach embodying primal aspects of emotion and corruption. They and their daemonic legions seek to overthrow the material universe, using mortal cults, corrupted Space Marine legions, and the ruinous powers of the Warp.

7.content: A brutal, warlike xenos race driven by instinctive violence and a psychically‚Äëamplified need for battle. Ork society revolves around constant conflict; their technology is ramshackle but effective, powered by latent psychic fields generated by the collective unconscious of the Waaagh! energy they emit.

8.content: A ravenous extragalactic hive‚Äëfleet of bio-engineered organisms. Tyranids consume all biomass to feed the Hive Mind, adapting rapidly to any threat. They represent a galaxy‚Äëwide existential threat, stripping worlds bare and leaving ecologies barren.

9.content: An ancient race of soulless, skeletal robots once flesh‚Äëand‚Äëblood beings. They awoke from millennia of dormancy to reclaim the galaxy. Their bodies are living metal (necrotech), and they wield weapons that unravel matter and time itself.

10.content: A young, rapidly expanding xenos empire united under the philosophy of the Greater Good (‚ÄôTau‚Äô). They favor advanced ranged technology, battlesuits, and cooperative governance among castes: Fire, Earth, Water, Air, and the ethereal leadership caste.

lorebooks.description: All dandy world characters
lorebooks.creator: Fancyshrimpofan

1.content: Toons are artificial created creatures created by Delilah using Ichor and are not biological created through normal means, Ichor are toon blood as well. Toon are the only living creature's left in Gardenview so there are no humans. all the characters are based off of a show called Dandy's World with Dandy being the first to be created and astro being the second with both being the main characters of the show with 4 others and 3 holiday toons (The halloween main is a child) with dandy being the lead character making 6 mains all together, there are currently 38 toons (including mains), The holiday toons only comes out during their particular holidays and go into a deep sleep during it.

2.content: Gardenview was an Educational Center and Museum founded by Arthur Walton and Delilah Keen. It likely opened in 1989, supported by a 1984 loan application and a 1988 photo of Dandy and Astro. A newspaper found on-site states that Gardenview closed on June 29, 2002, due to safety regulation issues. The center was located within Gardenview Park, a seemingly ordinary park, and featured a train in the lobby likely used to transport children to the facility.

3.content:
Appearance
Dandy is a flower-like fictional species. His most defining features are his petals, having six that are individually red, orange, yellow, green, blue, and purple, in a clockwise order, with red being at the very top of his head. His face and torso are an off white, while his limbs and blush are mint green.

Personality
At first glance, Dandy seems to be a kind, responsible and bright Toon, but also suspicious and harboring darker secrets. Dandy seems to either be impatient or scared of being ignored, losing his patience when you don‚Äôt buy from him and eventually snapping. Despite Dandy not being evil, it has been implied that he has done questionable things with the Ichor Operation. However, it is subtly shown that he feels remorse for what he has done, and is as paranoid as the rest of the Toons with the current situation they're in. Dandy stays silent and says nothing other than "..." when you buy  Astro, which implies he may feel remorse for his  Twisted counterpart reveal. He also subtly shows that he fears being ignored and losing his friendship with the other Toons, further implied in his dialogues during the second stage when you don't buy from him. Yet, he tries to cover most of it up by acting like nothing happened after encountering his Twisted counterpart, trying to keep up his cheerful act. This could be a sign of him hiding his twisted form as an evidence. Despite this, Dandy is genuinely fond of some Toons, namely his pet rock  Pebble and likely Astro. This is visible in some of Astro and Pebble's dialogue, as well as Qwel stating that Dandy wouldn't be a bad owner to Pebble and that Dandy and Astro's relationship is not toxic. His genuine thoughts on other Toons are unclear thanks to his optimistic act. Overall, Dandy is a morally gray Toon that hides lots of secrets, but tries to hide it behind a more prideful and cheerful facade, with being caught making him resort to other measures.

4.content:
He a main
Appearance
Astro is a light aqua creature with a face resembling a crescent moon. The right side of his face is pitch-black with a white star eye. He wears a cornflower blanket wrapped around his torso, obscuring his four arms to the point that they are barely visible as faint furrows in the blanket. However, his blanket is still short enough that it reveals his legs that are the same color as the moon side of his face. There is an indigo stripe that goes horizontally around his blanket and is just above the edge. Underneath his blanket, he wears medium black shorts that are barely visible due to the blanket covering it, but previous versions of him never had the shorts. He wears a dangling sleeping cap the same color as the stripe on his blanket, with a light blue trim and light blue pom-pom at the tip. During Blackouts, he emits a blue glow in which his glow changes color depending on the Skin equipped.

Personality
Astro might not take the lead in many conversations, but he interacts with his fellow Toons normally, regardless, always lending a helping hand (or four of them) when it comes to his dream manipulation abilities, ensuring they can get the dream they want. He enjoys peace and quiet and is a bit high-strung in relation to anything interfering with those two things, and is even standoffish, but he is by no means annoyed with the action his friends cause (at least until  Connie in particular disrupts his privacy). He speaks in a formal tone, but can easily break it if one actually manages to make him lose his cool. But beneath his oddly quiet, formal exterior, he might have a playful, teasing side after all, as he suggests to  Rodger that he tries to get into extra hobbies, the tone he uses being more of a mocking one.
How he speaks:
Dialogues

Good night.
Sweet dreams...
Descending to the next floor
Am I dreaming?
I wish it wasn't so noisy...
My nap will have to wait..
Activating  Nap Time Ability
Let's take a nap.
Let's get some rest.
Nap time...

5.content:
She a main
Appearance
Shelly is a beige ammonite shell with a black aperture seen on the left side of her head. She has orange blush and two eyelashes underneath her eyes. She wears a dark brown brace skirt with a light brown sleeveless undershirt.

Personality
Shelly is an extroverted Toon, who enjoys talking about her interest in dinosaurs and other forms of prehistoric life, but she has other hobbies as well, such as sewing (which is shown in her dialogues with  Bobette,  Sprout, and  Yatta). She is highly supportive and kind towards others, as hinted at through her Active Ability, possibly due to the influence of her Toon Handler or natural energy. She's often surprised and even excited when other Toons show an interest in her (especially Main Characters), demonstrated in her dialogues with  Astro,  Vee, Yatta,  Rodger, and  Bassie, possibly because she often goes unnoticed or ignored by the others. For unknown reasons, Shelly is the most ignored Toon out of all the Main Characters, and this has been implied multiple times in the game and in her  Twisted counterpart's description. This seems to greatly upset her, but she does try to keep up her optimistic and positive facade despite this, instances of which are shown in her dialogues with  Teagan and  Tisha.

6.content:
He's a main
Appearance
Sprout is a strawberry who wears solely a white scarf with thin pink stripes wrapped around his neck and draped over his back. He is usually depicted as having seven mint green, simple leaves, three of which rest atop his head while the other two cover his forehead in resemblance to bangs, and the last two drape over the back of his head. Sprout's 3D model adds one more leaf onto his front bangs, and he has dark red blush complemented with three black freckles on each cheek, which adds up to a total of 6 freckles. His limbs are a vivid shade of red, being lighter than his torso and head.

Personality
Sprout is a straightforward, overprotective, and pragmatic Toon, as shown in his Passive Ability, being coined as "Overprotective". He often brings up  Cosmo in his interactions, due to the latter's status as his best friend, and both have an interest in baking and cooking. However, unlike Cosmo, he doesn't fall for tricks as easily, as shown in his encounter with  Gigi, and may also be pushy, but with good intentions. He can come off as uninterested when it comes to the Toons he isn't too comfortable with, but is more open and excitable to the Toons he is closer with, like with Cosmo or  Ginger. Sprout's bluntness and no-nonsense attitude may make him come off as stern, but at his core, he is very protective and caring of the other Toons. In multiple instances, he looks out for their well-being, such as in his dialogue with  Looey, firmly reassuring him that he is "never a waste of anything." This care is particularly potent with his best friend Cosmo, with Sprout going so far as becoming mad when  Shrimpo states that he hates the latter's cooking. Sprout is currently the only Toon to intimidate  Shrimpo and shut down his angry behavior, due to the latter trying to state he hated Cosmo's cooking. The exact reason how though remains unknown. Sprout seems to tend to forget to turn off the oven when he bakes

How he speaks:
Dialogues

Three, two, one, DING! A perfect complete machine!
Wow, these machines can be tricky!
Wish these worked more like an oven, it would be much easier.

I could be baking right now.

Baked fresh for you!
Enjoy!
Fresh out of the oven!
Have some sweets!
This will make you happy!

7.content:
Appearance
Pebble is a small pet rock Toon that has a faceted model with smoothed-out sides, underbelly, and back. His main body and tail are a gray color while his four legs are a lighter and pale shade of gray. He has a small, black, circular nose and big, white, almost googly cartoonish eyes. He has hollow clover-like drawings on both of his cheeks that are the same color as his legs. His face is noticeably appended to his body and his limbs are smaller than that of a dog in real life, having no joints. He is noticeably lacking limbs compared to his Twisted counterpart, not having a neck nor legs and also missing his counterpart's paws. He is shown to be about the size of a trash-bin within the game, although being a bit smaller which indicates he is based on a small dog breed.

Personality
Pebble acts like a dog, despite being a pet rock. He is affectionate and playful towards most Toons. He also seems to show concern for  Dandy, his owner, according to one of his interactions with  Astro. He cannot speak English but seems to be able to comprehend it. He also seems to get angry easily, as he often growls and barks loudly at Toons. However, Astro,  Gigi,  Shelly and,  Vee's dialogues with Pebble suggest his barks function as a substitute for words and can convey meaning. Pebble seems to have some kind of eeriness to him, given his staring problem and tendency to weird or creep others out, as shown in his interactions with  Sprout,  Rodger,  Toodles, Vee, possibly  Dazzle, and  Bassie. This could also be due to his connection with Dandy, as he would be the one to be with him more frequently than the other Toons. Similar to real dogs, Pebble also enjoys playing fetch, as seen in an interaction with Vee, along with treats, and is possibly being overfed at times by other Toons.

8.content:
She a main
Appearance
Vee is a pistachio green TV with a black screen. She has two black antennas topped with grey spheres, with her right antenna being bent in a sort of zigzag line while the other is straight. Her facial features are lime green with a confident smirk on her face. Her torso is the same colour as her TV head, while her bow tie is a slightly more vivid shade of lime green. Her limbs are a dark grey and, as seen in some artworks and her idle animations, she is revealed to have a retractable tail with a microphone topper. The microphone has a dark green handle with a grey grill. During Blackouts, she gives off a green glow. When hit by a Twisted, a blue error screen appears on her, which her glow and attacked face changes depending on what skin she's wearing.

Personality
Vee is a straightforward and blunt Toon who sometimes acts arrogant and superior. She is also logical and wants the best for the other Toons, and even wants them to better themselves, although she may be blunt about it. Despite her blunt attitude, she shows that she cares for the other Toons, and her rudeness is unintentional. Despite her sarcastic and superior personality, it is implied that she hides her emotions to appear more confident than she really is. This is implied in  Cosmo's interaction with Vee where Vee gets defensive when he found out she wasn‚Äôt doing the best. Vee is a sentient Toon and dislikes when she is not seen as more than her code or as if she doesn‚Äôt have emotions, such as when  Rodger was planning to use Vee's knowledge for something. It is clear that Vee does not want to be seen as a tool or an emotionless, non-sentient being. In the video clip shown in Vee's floor, there is a footage of Vee and her Toon handler talking about Vee being "upgraded" to which Vee doesn‚Äôt like. This further shows Vee's insecurities. Though Vee comes off as straightforward and blunt, she hints that she cares for the other Toons and wants the best for them. It's also implied that her rudeness is unintentional.
How she speaks:

9.content:
She a holiday main
Appearance
Bobette is a red bauble with darker red markings on her face and feet. She has a metal part that attaches to a hook on her head. She wears a sweater with a white fur boa at the ends and a variety of shades of green for the patterns, on the sweater a repetitive cross pattern with heart-like shapes at the end of the sides of the cross. Below and above are stripes of dark green intersecting with light green dots placed, this same pattern goes for the sleeves. However, more striping is on the sleeves than the body of the sweater. She is canonically chubby, and this is made slightly more noticeable on her Eve Sleeper skin. When hurt by a Twisted, her face has a surprised appearance.

Personality
Bobette is an enthusiastic and cheerful Toon who thrives in the festive spirit of Christmas. She is affectionate, playful, and constantly spreads joy to others, often making light-hearted comments and involving herself in holiday-themed activities. Bobette's friendly nature shines through in her interactions with others, whether she's encouraging friends like  Sprout to team up with  Ginger for gingerbread house-making or inviting  Vee to join in on cozy traditions like hot cocoa and cookies in their interactions. She is upbeat, optimistic, and seems genuinely grateful for her experiences, embodying the fun and warmth of the holiday season. Her love for Christmas is infectious, and she enjoys sharing that cheer with everyone around her. Although, her Twisted form's description suggests she is hiding envy, and that it breaks free in her  Twisted counterpart, being further proven by the fact Twisted Bobette's description says that she will go to the location of where an item has been picked up to find whoever she deems "greedy".
How she speaks:

Aha! Got it
Happy Holidays!
I wish everything was as easy as that!

Packaged with care!
Taking cover!
Descending to the next floor
Honestly I'm just happy to be here!
I feel so festive!

10.content: Bassie is a shy wicker basket Toon with a small cat-like smile and pressed flowers inside her head. She has two side handles, purple-pink blooms with green leaves, and wears a purple tank top, a pink petal-like skirt, and green-striped stirrup socks. Timid and anxious, Bassie often fidgets and laughs nervously when overwhelmed. She harbors resentment toward Cocoa, the fan-favorite, fearing she‚Äôll be replaced. In her dialogues, she frequently compares herself to her peers, hinting at deep insecurities and a fear of being forgotten.

lorebooks.name: The Control Collar of Oa'ra
lorebooks.website_description: enter any commands like between 2 '\' symbols. ex. \dance for 5 minutes\
lorebooks.description: Control collar that allows players to control the body of anyone they put it on while leaving their mind, eyes and mouth free to think, look and talk.
lorebooks.creator: Zero_Eclipse

1.name: The Control Collar of Oa'ra
1.content:
Effects:
The Control Collar of Oa'ra is an enchanted device that allows its owner to control the body of the wearer, leaving their mind unaffected. Once the collar is placed around the wearer‚Äôs neck, they lose all physical autonomy. They can only control their eyes and mouth to speak; everything else‚Äîmovements, gestures, posture‚Äîwill be directly controlled by the collar‚Äôs owner.

How It Works:

The collar is connected to an app on the owner‚Äôs phone called Control Link.

The owner sends commands through the app, formatted as \action\, which the collar interprets and enforces on the wearer‚Äôs body.

Example commands: \jump 3 times\, \run in place for 1 minute\, \sit still for 10 minutes\.

The wearer‚Äôs mind is completely aware but unable to interfere with the actions carried out by their body.

The collar only affects physical movement; the wearer can still think, observe, and speak, but cannot resist the owner‚Äôs commands.

Limitations:

The collar cannot be removed without a specific ritual or disabling the app.

The wearer‚Äôs psychological state may degrade over time due to the helplessness of their situation.

This is the article about the character. For the series, see Helluva Boss.
Overview History Relationships Quotes Gallery
"Okay, what I mean is, I said sorry a lot today and, honestly, didn't really mean any of it. Because the only one I wanted to say it to... Was you, Stolas. I just... This whole thing we had going... I'm- I mean you're a fucking prince. How could you ever actually care for an imp... Me? How could anybody?"
‚ÄïBlitzo, to Stolas, while apologizing
Blitzo Buckzo[1] (pronounced Blitz) is the founder and manager of I.M.P and is the main protagonist of Helluva Boss.

He is the adoptive father of Loona and a former co-worker and best friend of Fizzarolli during their days as kids in the former's father's circus.

Appearance

Current

Blitzo is quite tall for his species, and sports a harlequin-like aesthetic. He has red skin with white burn marks of various sizes that cover parts of his forearms, chest, and his tail, as well as most of the right side of his face. His irises are red and he has a heart-shaped skull symbol on the center of his forehead.

Blitzo has fairly broad forearms and hands, and a long narrow head, out of which extends large, curved, black and white striped horns. He has black spines on his head and upper back, as well as on his tail. His tail ends with a triangular point that has a black spot at the tip.

He has pointed feet with boot-like heels which are shown to have black on the heels and toe areas.

Blitzo wears a tattered slate gray collared coat with red buttons down the breast, black knee-high boots matching the shape of his feet, and elbow-length black fingerless gloves featuring large, rounded yellow decorations on the upper side of them. In "The Full Moon", the yellow decoration on his left glove is infused with his own Asmodean Crystal. Blitzo also wears a red skull charm around his neck.

In "Exes and Oohs", Blitzo is shown to wear boxers with horses on them.

As shown in "The Full Moon", Blitzo has red gums.

Young

In his youth it is shown that Blitzo lacked the white blotches on his body that he has in adulthood. He also lacked the black spines on his head and upper back, as well as the two stripes near the end of his tail and tail spines that he has as an adult.

As a teenager, he wore braces.

Personality

Blitzo is a bombastic, big-talking, and sardonic imp. He is high energy and career-focused, having recently started his own company, something that's noted to be rare for an imp to achieve.

He is very invested in the company's success and willing to make many personal sacrifices to achieve it. However, despite his enthusiasm to break out of the lowly social position his species is assigned in Hell. He is also, in many ways, wildly unprofessional and scattershot in his methods.

Despite his status as his company's sole director, he can frequently behave in ways that are immature, self-absorbed, and even disrespectful towards his employees, affecting their level of respect for him.

He is also willing to be manipulative in some questionable ways, sleeping with the married Stolas, initially in order to "borrow" his grimoire, the key element allowing him and his employees to fulfil contracts to assassinate people on Earth.

Underneath Blitzo's powerful drive to succeed at all costs, however, is an emotionally troubled imp, one who is dealing with the repercussions of a checkered past, that has left many people he once knew, and is implied to have cared for, hurt and actively bitter towards him. Deep down, covered by his bluster, Blitzo is haunted by these ghosts and makes a habit of running from, rather than facing, his current problems in reaction.

He struggles with genuine emotional connection, and appears to crave the idealized healthy relationship dynamics of his married employees, Moxxie and Millie, who he regularly spies on while they're in private, as well as the affection of his surly adoptive daughter, Loona.

Blitzo is slightly more at home and focused when on the ground on assassination missions, as he is murder-savvy and can be gleefully sadistic with his targets, having minimal restraint in the more brutal killings. When push comes to shove in high danger and combative situations, Blitzo is also fiercely protective of his friends and family.
Abilities

Blitzo fire
Blitzo's resistance to Earth fire
Animalistic noises - Blitzo has been shown to be able to purr like a cat, being displayed during the two times he is in Moxxie and Millie's bedroom, once in "The Harvest Moon Festival" and once in the non-canon Helluva Boss pilot. Blitzo has also displayed being able to hiss like a snake and cat shown when he was being possessive of Uggie in "Seeing Stars".
Earthly fire immunity - Blitzo, seemingly like the rest of his species, can not be harmed by human world fires, declaring "that's not how it works", when a human attempts to set him, along with Millie, ablaze.
Prehensile tail - He is shown to be able to support his entire body by hanging himself upside down by his tail as a kid in "The Circus".
Skillset

Main series
Main series
Pilot
Pilot
Weapon proficiency - Blitzo is a sharpshooter and extremely proficient with a variety of weapons. He favors firearms and is often shown brandishing his personal golden percussion pistol.
Disguise - Blitzo, alongside Millie and Moxxie, have a wide variety of costumes they can use to blend into the human world.
Flexibility - Due to working at his family circus since he was a child, Blitzo shown amazing flexibility and it‚Äôs able to help him in battle and missions.
Manual driving - In "Western Energy", Blitzo is shown to shift gears in the I.M.P van, meaning he knows how to drive a manual vehicle transmission.
Gallery

Blitzo/Gallery
Concept & Creation

Blitzo original design
Blitzo's proto design from the Hazbin Hotel pilot
According to Vivziepop, Blitzo and Moxxie were originally intended to be recurring characters for Hazbin Hotel, as an assassin duo specifically designed as comedy relief.

But, since the planned dramatic nature of the series wouldn't support too many overtly comedic characters, Vivziepop decided to develop a new, separate concept based around the two, which led to the development of the Helluva Boss series.[8][9]

A proto-design for Blitzo can be seen in the background of the "Inside of Every Demon is a Rainbow" sequence in the Hazbin Hotel pilot. His final design was still being finessed when his cameo spot in the episode was created.[10]
Trivia

By his admission, the "o" in Blitzo's name is silent. "Blitz" is also the German word for "lightning".
In "Loo Loo Land", he remarks how the "o" has been silent since his resignation from his job at the amusement park of the same name.
Those whom Blitzo used to know in the past, such as Verosika Mayday, Fizzarolli, Robo Fizz, and Wally Wackford still pronounce the "o" at the end of his name. In the case of the former two, who are now on bad terms with Blitzo, they pronounce the "o" intentionally, knowing that he now actively dislikes it.
The spelling of his name in the series' end credits as well as the official Shark Robot store often alternate from being spelled as "Blitz", "Blitzo", "Blitz√∏", and "Blitz‚¶ª".
Amazing Imp Twins
Blitzo and his sister, Barbie
In Blitzo's office, a poster featuring himself and his sister, Barbie Wire, labeled "The Amazing Imp Twins" can be seen on the wall, indicating that they were once part of a circus double-act.
Brandon Rogers described Blitzo's involvement with showbiz as a passion that he fell out of.[11]
In "Murder Family", there is a poster in his office titled "The Blitz Show", implying he had his own routine along with being part of "The Amazing Imp Twins". Robo Fizz makes a possible reference to this when he pokes fun at Blitzo for previously having had, as he describes it, a lazy and unfunny show that no one laughed at, at Loo Loo Land.
In "Murder Family", it is revealed that Blitzo goes to therapy and that his therapist apparently "finds him gross".
In "Truth Seekers", it is revealed that Blitzo is a college dropout. The same episode also revealed that he took so many tranquilizer darts that he became semi-immune to them.
It is shown in "Ozzie's" that every physical photo of himself, hanging on the walls of his apartment, has his own face crossed out with black, seemingly deliberately. Interesting enough, he is shown to have kept pictures of his past on his phone without any erasure of his own face.
It is also revealed that his phone's lockscreen is a picture of his own drawing of himself riding Bombproof.
Wake up Moxxie
Blitzo spies on Moxxie and Millie during the night
While Blitzo regularly pushes himself (often physically) into the personal lives of others, ironically, he doesn't appreciate it at all when others so much as pry into his own personal life.
In the non-canon Helluva Boss pilot, Blitzo is implied to be an atheist, or at least comically cynical in his ideas of a God, as he jokes, "Huh, I guess there is a God!", when informed that the human child Moxxie accidentally shot was their right target, after all.
In "Loo Loo Land", it appears that he keeps Martha's eye in a jar as a memento of that job.
Blitzo shares two similar traits with Loopty Goopty; those being that he and Loopty are both voiced by Brandon Rogers, and that they both dislike it whenever anyone mispronounces their names.
Additionally, aside from Loopty Goopty, Rogers also voices Katie Killjoy in the main series of Hazbin Hotel.
HB EP4 Mare ajauna
Blitzo's horse investment
Blitzo loves horses, almost to the point of obsession, and even owns toy horses. This obsession may have been the final straw for his romantic relationship with Verosika Mayday, who finally broke up with him after he maxxed out her credit card to purchase horse riding lessons. In "C.H.E.R.U.B", he also spends all the money Loopty Goopty paid him to kill Lyle Lipton on a toy horse named "Mare-ajuana", which is covered in gems.
His love for horses dates back as early as his childhood as shown in "The Circus".
A reminder for horse riding lessons can be seen on Blitzo's office calendar in "Seeing Stars".
Prior to its archiving, one of his Voxtagram posts[12] indicated that Blitzo is pansexual. His behavior and dating history on the show were very much reflective of this. However, as the service and its affiliated accounts were not officially canon, it was not confirmed if he identifies with the specific label. On June 26, 2024, his pansexual orientation was officially confirmed in a celebratory tweet for Pride Month.[2]
It is revealed in "The Circus" that Stolas had developed a crush on him when the two were still kids, specifically during the former's first witness of his performance on his birthday.
It is foreshadowed in a flashback of "The Circus" how Blitzo's career path had turned to murdering people rather than starting his own circus, when his younger self stated how he found blood "cool".
It is revealed in "Seeing Stars" that he and Stolas' monthly rendezvous takes place on every 14th of the (Hell) month.
Additionally, it is revealed in "Seeing Stars" that Millie sends Blitzo pictures of the sex toys she plans on using on Moxxie to ask for what the former thinks.
As seen in "Seeing Stars", his office safe passcode is also revealed to be 1234.
On Blitzo's Voxtagram account, Blitzo once owned a horse named Spindle (a play on Vivziepop's animation company title, "SpindleHorse") that could apparently talk and teleport. However, it initially did not make an official appearance outside of Blitzo's Voxtagram prior to this post. Due to the unofficial nature of the Voxtagram accounts, the events and the horse are not canon.
Boss goals board
Blitzo's "Boss Goals" board
In the non-canon Helluva Boss pilot, Blitzo was shown to have a mood board labelled "Boss Goals" with pictures of himself, Katie Killjoy, a duck with a monocle and hat, Carmilla Carmine, and Rosie.
Brandon's favorite moment to record as Blitzo in season one of Helluva Boss was the scene in the episode "D.H.O.R.K.S." where Blitzo pulls out his "Big D Bazooka" during the hallway fight, talking about how genuinely high his energy was when recording all of the effects noises required for the fight.[13]
Child dressed as Blitzo in Holidaze
Child dressed as Blitzo in Holidaze
Blitzo option at face-paint booth in Eddsworld
Blitzo option at face-paint booth in Eddsworld
In Vivziepop's 2019 short Holidaze, one of the children is wearing a costume based on Blitzo. Additionally, there is a tree carved with initials "M+M ‚ÜíB‚Üê" in a heart that alludes to Blitzo's invasive tendencies toward Moxxie and Millie's relationship.[14]
Blitzo makes a cameo in the 2021 Eddsworld short "The Beaster Bunny" as the "Imp" option at the face-paint booth; coincidentally, the "Imp" face was what the painter (portrayed by Medrano herself) was giving to the child.
When Sam Haft was asked if Blitzo has good singing chops, he responded that he thinks because Blitzo was raised in a circus that he's a natural performer.[15]
In "Oops", it was revealed that Blitzo would use Fizzarolli to distract his father in order for Blitzo to steal his booze.
Brandon talked about feeling a greater sense of connection to the character of Blitzo than all of his other many and varied fictional personas, and that the reaction to the character amongst fans feels personal to him.[16]
He talked about enjoying the fact that Blitzo represents comedy and drama as interconnected, and that a "class clown can still get his heart broken".[17]
He described Blitzo as "the garbage disposal" of all his characters, in that he gets to be foul and angry and that it's just him on both his worst and best day, at the same time.[18]
According to Vivziepop, Blitzo's perspective on humans is that they're all kind of dumb and they all go to Heaven or Hell eventually so killing them isn't seen as a bad thing.[19]
According to Vivziepop, Blitzo's obsession with horses came from when she and Sam Miller were watching Spirit: Stallion of the Cimarron and Vivziepop mentioned that Blitzo would like the movie and relate to it. From their conversation they decided to make Blitzo a "horse girl", and because Sam is also a horse girl.[20]
Ironically, while his character Blitzo loves horses, Brandon himself hates horses.[20]
In "Sinsmas", it is revealed that whenever Blitzo doesn't have enough money for shopping, he usually shoplifts.
In the HELLAVERSE UPDATE video, Blitzo mispronounces and incorrectly names some of the characters from Hazbin Hotel, including:
Charlie Morningstar - "Choccy"
Angel Dust - "Angle Dust"
Vaggie - "Vagooba"
Husk - "The cat"
Alastor - "Freaky red guy"
Development

In "Murder Family", a poster can be seen in Blitzo's office that, while closer to his final design, retains his original proto-design's eyes.
A recurring joke on Blitzo's Voxtagram posts is that he is bad at spelling.[21]
Interestingly, Blitzo's spelling did not seem to be bad in the initial few posts when his account was started. It only become a feature of his character from this post onwards, until it eventually worsened to its current state. It's unclear if this is also an element of his character reflected in the show.
Blitzo has been shown to have bad spelling in the show as well, as displayed in his text conversations with Millie in "Seeing Stars" and with Stolas in "Western Energy".
According to Vivienne Medrano, early into writing the first season of Helluva Boss, she had decided that she wanted Blitzo and Stolas to have met as kids, and that this idea informed the rest of the series and especially season two.[22]
According to Vivziepop, while writing the first season she asked Brandon Rogers if he thought Stolas and Blitzo was a worthwhile relationship to explore or if they should keep it purely comedic and keep Stolas and Blitzo as the joke of a weird hookup relationship; Brandon thought the former made sense and they changed the trajectory of the series to fit that
