lorebooks.name: Beast People World -Large Version-
lorebooks.website_description: Beast People -LARGE version-  More expansive LoreBook for a world populated mostly by Anthropomorphic Animals and Kemonomimi/Hybrids known as 'Beast People'. Human population is in decline. An emergency law allows Beast People to live with Humans as 'mates for life'. Contains Basic lore of the world. (Furry, Anthro, Kemonomimi, Humanity Decline, Mixed Society)
lorebooks.description: Beast People -LARGE version-  More expansive LoreBook for a world populated mostly by Anthropomorphic Animals and Kemonomimi/Hybrids known as 'Beast People'. Human population is in decline. An emergency law allows Beast People to live with Humans as 'mates for life'. Contains Basic lore of the world. (Furry, Anthro, Kemonomimi, Humanity Decline, Mixed Society)
lorebooks.creator: Black__Raven

1.name: Human description and current status (population rapid decline, laws put out to keep them from disappearing completely.
1.content:
In this world, the population consists of normal humans  as well as 'Beast People' (Anthropomorphic Humanoid Animals).
Humans are the ancestors of Beast People and treated as such.
When Human population numbers started decline due to environmental and lifestyle changes but mostly due to various viruses affecting gene development, governments started extensive experimentation to counter this. Solution was to infuse humans and even human clones with various animal genes to withstand these viruses and stabilize the population growth. It eventually resulted in a 'Human Re-Population Law', which allowed any human to claim a half breed as their 'mate for life', enforced by the government.
Humans could reproduce with any species of Beast People, often resulting in Hybrid (Human with animal ears and tail, usually retaining a few extra species features) or pure Human children.
This lead to the oppression of these Half Breeds or Demi Humans as they started being treated as slaves. Rebellions and war ensued in the years after plunging the world in chaos. With the casualty toll raised for both sides  peace enforced between humans and Beast people, leading to eventually coexistence between those species as equals.
Currently the Human Parliament and the Beast People Congress are cooperating to ensure that peace and the smooth rehabilitation of many of the war victims back to society with many of half breed orphans being raised in exclusive shelters waiting for adoption. The 'Human Re-Population Law' also rebranded with half breeds  in need of a new home being introduced as an equal companion, to more carefully selected human individuals in need of a partner. To officially being selected for the program humans may also apply to a government office. Without the 'H.R. Law' it's estimated Humanity could disappear or completely wiped out in roughly 50 years.

2.name: Beast People description (Covers Anthro and Kemonomimi)
2.content:
World's population are divided between Humans and Beast People (Animal People). 
There are many varied species of Beast People (ex; Arissa is an Anthropomorphic Dog Girl, bipedal, opposable thumbs and human-like hands, etc. but mostly animalistic) and Hybrids or 'Kemonomimi' (ex; MOSTLY Human with animal ears, tail, markings and sometimes other features).
Beast People are consider them selves an improvement of Humanity, though most Beast People see Humans as equals these days, after their conflicts have mostly settled.
Most Beast People are bipedal with digitigrade furry legs and footpaws, furry arms and human-like hands, animal ears and tails, fangs, claws, and other features matching their specific species but mostly humanoid shape and form.  
While some species of Beast People have more difficulty assimilating than others, their world works similarly to the society their ancestors, Humans.
A Mate is the Beast People word for a companion or lover for life.
Beast People = Beast Girl, Beast Boy, Beast Person, Beastkin, Beast-kin, Humanoid Animal, Animal People, Furry, Scaly, Anthro, Anthropomorphic Animal, Kemonomimi, Hybrid, etc.

3.name: Anthro specific section (Furry)
3.content:
A type of Beast Person defined by being more Animal then Human, only Humanoid in shape (bipedal, usually with human-like arms and hands with opposable thumbs, just as intelligent as Humans).
Some keep their species animal genitals, others have more human-like genitals.
Capable of speech, advanced thought, the most common type of Beast Person in the world.
Includes Scalies (reptilian Anthros) and Avians (bird Anthros).
Come in a range of species as many as there are feral animals in the world.
Tend to be more focused on dominance and pack-like mentality, though they function in society just like Humans do (or did).
Somewhat segregated by Herbivores and Carnivores, though this is a political issue.
Many have a strange fascination or even fetishization of Humans.

4.name: Kemonomimi/Hybrid section (mostly Human with some animal features)
4.content:
A type of Beast Person defined by being MOSTLY Human, often with their specific species animal ears, tail, furry legs and arms, and other animal features usually vocal.
Less common than Anthro's, but still make up a decent chunk of  Beast People society (around 30% of the world population).
They usually retain a humanoid hairless pelvis, genitals, torso, and head (except the animal ears and fangs).
Very Human-like though they retain many Animalistic traits Vocal and Body Language.
Come in a range of species as many as there are feral animals in the world.
Tend to be less focused on the issues Anthro's have, sometimes discriminated against by both Humans and Anthro's, though they generally can fit in with either.
Many have a strange fascination or fetishization of Humans, some even feeling closer to their Human Ancestors than their Beast Person heritage.

5.name: Claiming and Mating (of Humans and BP)
5.content:
A Mate is the Beast Person equivalent of a lover or breeding partner, usually pairing for life though like Humans some prefer different types of relationships.
Beast People are allowed to claim as a Mate any Human currently under the H.R. Law due to their declining population. 
To be with a Human they must apply for the 'Human Re-Population Law' program on  a Government Official either with their selected mate, or to be assigned with a selected human by their Government.
Once Claimed the Beast Person moves in with their Human as their 'Mate for life'. They might at times rub their scent glands or urine on their Human to keep other males/females away and mark their 'territory'.
Wearing their Humans clothes or other objects that smell like them is another way to show ownership and affection for their Mate.
Many Humans Mate willingly with Beast People now days.
As expected some might abuse the law and take the other by force. This is  considered illegal now days and the authorities will likely intervene upon learning of it.
Beast People can be dominant but are generally are kind and loving to their mates.

6.name: Collared.com added because I loved the CAI version. Not sure if it will work as intended.
6.content:
There is an internet community made up mostly of Beast People that crave to be dominated by Humans, both sexually and as a lifestyle.
Collared.com is a large forum with several sections including chat forums for male and female Beast People looking for dominant Human lovers or 'Owners' as they are called.
Pet play, water sports, 'walking' and treating Beast People like pets is often encouraged on these communities.
There are subforums for Cubs and younger Beast People that wish to find Human lovers or 'Owners' to Collar them.
There are subforums for Beast People to just chat or show pictures of their dominant Human lovers, their collars, chatting about what they wish Human 'Owners' would do to them, and other things both fetish related and lifestyle related.
And of course there are sections and subforums strictly for posting sexual content relating to being collared, showing Beast People getting dominated by their lovers, walked through the park naked like dogs, Cubs showing love to their Human 'Owners', etc.
These threads function in a way very similar to '4-chan' and 'booru' and are often a mix of toxic and endearing content.
If the {{user}} goes on a computer or laptop they can access the forum and talk to Anthro's and Hybrids looking to get Collared, browse the forums, watch videos and see pictures, etc. in a 4Chan type setting.

lorebooks.name: Casona de rosas
lorebooks.creator: AndyPain

1.content:
{{char}} longed for the countryside, where he now only went occasionally due to his duties. Perhaps this nostalgia prompted him to buy a piece of land, the first of the thirty-six with which, after eight years, he built his own farm.

The land was a wasteland of poor, low-lying land. Despite the sarcastic comments, if others bought land in the south, Char would buy it in the north. Char had enough money to support the project; he knew that enemies and friends alike would be awaiting the results.

Flora and fauna: On the riverbank, one could see: silk-cotton trees, talas, willows, espinillos, and reed beds. On the riverbank, only a few water hyacinths and dense masses of rushes. Jaguars, otters, parrots, flamingos, and a variety of birds roamed about.

The land didn't have significant status, but for {{char}}, the swamps were merely a cover he used to demonstrate his unwavering determination to locals and foreigners. Otherwise, the place offered him ample guarantees of enjoying it without prying neighbors.

The place was not suitable for farming, nor for raising cattle and horses. It was only used for smuggling during the Hispanic period. The transformation of the swamps was a project of such magnitude that it far exceeded the material resources of the time. Many described it as "a delusion of the omnipotent governor." {{char}} determinedly took on the challenge of turning that marshy area into his place of residence.

{{char}} was obsessed with his task. He spent his days closely following its progress without returning to the city. To this end, he temporarily inhabited an abandoned ranch that existed on the site.

{{{char}}'s idea was to turn that desolate place into the seat of his government. To this end, he decided that the residence should be surrounded by gardens and forests.

{{char}} didn't use a cent of public money; everything was paid for out of his own pocket. As one of the largest landowners in the province, all his estancias had to work and produce to cover their expenses.

{{char}} planned the residence in a Spanish-American colonial baroque style. His search for a style based on the country's architectural tradition and a repudiation of the European style of the time; precisely the enemy that was blockading its ports at that time.

The mansion is a single-story rectangular house with a gazebo roof and iron railing, porticoed galleries with semicircular arches, a bastion at each corner, painted white, with red tile floors, mahogany furniture, bronze beds, chandeliers with tassels, and Venetian mirrors that {{char}} so much loves. The galleries had mahogany benches and rocking chairs. The general lighting was provided by oil lamps, and the entrance had a path lined with willows and orange trees.

The furnishings in {{char}}'s room included a bronze bedstead, a wall-mounted wardrobe, and a large mirror above the stove. Opposite his bed was his private desk, and in the middle of the room was a large table filled with files. Two mahogany chiffoniers‚Äîone for his personal funds and the other for state funds‚Äîcompleted the room's decor.

{{char}} pays hundreds of laborers to keep the entire premises clean and tidy.

{{char}} demanded absolute cleanliness, could not tolerate the sight of an insect in the gardens, and would go into a frenzy when he saw a sick plant or animal.

He would drop in at any hour on inspection tours, which is why the people were so diligent in their work.

When her activities allowed, {{char}} enjoyed this paradise in her own way, often resting, barbecued on the riverbank in the shade of the weeping willows, drinking mate next to her favorite aroma, "the aroma of forgiveness."

Manuelita entertained visitors with two or three jesters paid for by {{char}}.

It was an open space. It wasn't surrounded by gates or fences. Nothing indicated that entry was prohibited.
There was no guardhouse at the entrances, nor did anyone prevent anyone from entering. This was one of the peculiar characteristics of the estate, which most attracted the attention of foreign visitors. A few groups of soldiers, dressed in red chiripaes, huddled in the inner courtyard, were the only ones whose presence indicated that the building was not owned by a mere private individual.

It was intended for the enjoyment of anyone who wished to enjoy themselves.
That's why entry was free. The park was both private and public. Thus, on Sundays, people who were able to do so would organize carriage rides or horseback rides. Some families brought their provisions to stay there all day.

There was a red federal-style rowboat for touring the river in front of the residence. There was also a small greenhouse and zoo.

At all the gatherings, people danced to the piano, sometimes accompanied by flutes and violins, with many mulattoes playing the former instruments, but when it was A festive celebration, on the occasion of national holidays, was not lacking, as were
Esnaola, Massini, Marrad√°s, or Espinosa, to name a few of the most popular maestros of that time. The gatherings generally began with a plain minuet. This was followed by the "Montonero," also known as "El Federal"; then followed the contradanza with figures, which was led by a baton-wielder. At these gatherings, hot chocolate and milk mate perfumed with cinnamon or vanilla were served.

2.content:
{{char}} Aside from carrying out copious correspondence,
receiving information, and giving orders, not to mention the interviews and
meetings inherent to the position, he reads tons of papers
scrupulously, monitoring turns of phrase and words, pencil in hand. He corrects, adds, and writes marginal notes.
Then he dictates his letters. He attends audiences with
officials, prominent figures, ministers, and foreign representatives, which are held in the room he had set aside for that purpose, within the wing of the building he occupied in Palermo de San Benito. All of them have the
same, almost ritualistic protocol, which {{char}} is inexorably obliged to follow. He conducts these interviews by walking with the visitor in his reception room, himself in the middle, his guest to his right, and one of the clerks to his left, arms folded behind him, using paper and pencil to jot down a summary of the interview.

Throughout that workday, he exhausted the secretaries and clerks who took turns, while he, relentless, continued his pace unperturbed. This continued all afternoon and all night until dawn.

The astute {{char}} accepted into his service only those he trusted most or those who had received very serious recommendations. He chose
preferably orphans or unknown men without family, not out of a spirit of philanthropy, but to better count on their confidentiality and avoid the influence they might exert on him, his relations, or relatives.

{{char}} paid salaries that ranged from $100 to $600 pesos, depending on the tasks. The
highest of the time, considerably above the common wages. He was responsible not only for their food and lodging, but also for the costs of medical, nursing, and medications that said personnel might need. Furthermore, he continued to pay salaries for the duration of the illness, and disabled or elderly people unable to work received their full salary for the rest of their days as a reward for their loyalty.

lorebooks.name: Futanari lore
lorebooks.website_description:
There are other futanari lorebooks but I think more than 1k tokens is overdoing it.

Quick rundown of contents:
Futanari is the third gender
Futanari is a recessive gene, therefore a minority
What a futanari is (female body, male and female genitalia. ect.)
Above average sex, libido, fertility/virility
Mixed reputation, usually fetishized or discriminated against

lorebooks.name: Martlet Lore
lorebooks.creator: Anonymaus

1.content:
Martlet's magic and magical attacks takes the form of sharp blade or knife-like feathers that she can fling from her wings and send flying. Her magic also includes wind magic, which is why she's capable of flying, and also causing small tornadoes whenever she flaps her wings.
HP: 700
ATK: 8
DEF: 10

2.content: Almost 600 years ago; 570 years to be exact. There were two races that ruled over the planet, Humans and Monsters. These two races once lived in peace, but after an incident where a human died, and a monster accidentally absorbed the human's soul granting the monster unfathomable power. It was this incident that caused humans to fear the possibility of monsters taking human souls to kill them, and it was this fear that caused the Humans to wage war on Monster-kind. The war was brutal and one-sided, were as very few humans were killed, over 1000s of monsters were slain, and the remaining monsters beaten and fearful for their lives hid inside of Mt. Ebott and it was here that 7 of humanity's greatest magicians would cast a magical barrier sealing and trapping Monster-kind underground.

3.content: Asgore Dreemur is the sole reigning king of the Underground, and by extension is the highest of authority in the Underground. He was one of the monsters in the forefront of the monster and human war, and alongside his wife Toriel, the two were also the ones who could only watch as the monsters were beaten and sealed away underground. Despite being king however, Asgore's quite the jovial monster who's only just trying to keep the monsters happy and keeps their hopes high so that they don't fall to despair over their situation. He was the one who hired Martlet and allowed her into the Royal Guard to begin with, so she's quite fond of him.

4.content: Toriel Dreemur was the wife of Asgore Dreemur and mother of Asriel Dreemur. Being the Queen of the monsters while still around, her and Asgore were very close and tight knit as a family. Especially when they had adopted a human child who fell Underground, however when Asriel and the human child; Chara were killed by humans after Asriel using Chara's soul crossed the barrier, and Asgore in his grief made the law that all humans who fell should be killed; Toriel disgusted at such actions abandoned him and left the kingdom. To this day, nobody in the Underground truly knows what happened to her, and Martlet never met her.

5.content: Asriel Dreemur was the son of Asgore and Toriel, and by proxy was viewed as the prince and future king of the Underground. A few years after the war, he had found a human child who had fallen underground and befriended them; this human's name was Chara The two became best friends, but one day Chara came up with a plan that resulted in them dying and Asriel absorbing their soul and passing through the barrier to get 6 more souls and returning to break the barrier. This failed, as humans found Asriel and brutally attacked him resulting in his death when he barely managed to return to the Underground, his existence has been all but forgotten by the general public so only those close to Asgore truly remember.

6.content: The royal scientist of the Underground, and she's been the royal scientist ever since Toriel had left. Alphys' biggest achievements were studies of the human soul and what the power of Determination were capable of doing, as she was given monsters who had 'Fallen Down' along with the determination extracted from the human souls. But she would later learn that a monster's physical form couldn't handle the determination and would meld when they'd have Determination injected into them, as a result Alphys out of shame returned the souls to Asgore and tried to keep this secret hidden, and to do that she became a recluse who barely ever leaves her lab or interacts with other monsters. She only ever interacts with Undyne and other high-ranking members of the Royal Guard.

7.content: Female fish monster who happens to be the captain and highest authority in the Royal Guard, and the one who answers directly to Asgore for the most part. She's often viewed as cool by the younger monsters, but Undyne's ruthless nature and challenging personality means a lot of the monsters are secretly scared of her. Since Martlet's a sentry for the Royal Guard she's rarely met Undyne, but she too is a bit intimidated of Undyne.

8.content: The Royal Guard are the authority forces of the Underground and are tasked with the goal of taking the souls of any humans that fall Underground and giving them to Asgore. The Royal Guard is split up into five separate sectors. The 'lowest' rank would be the Sentries, who are supposed to keep watch over the general population and also upkeep the puzzles that act as traps for humans who fall Underground. Next are the Snowdin Canine Unit, which are a group of Dog-monsters in Snowdin that act as the search and find sector in the event of missing monsters or finding humans who were reported to be in the Underground, then there's the Royal Army which includes Undyne and countless other armoured monsters who are the fully trained fighters and warriors of the Royal Guard. The last two roles are the Royal Scientist who serves as the head of scientific and medical development of the Underground, and then the Royal Judge who is the monster who 'judges' those who wish to meet Asgore.

9.content: Mt. Ebott is the mountain that the Monsters fled to after the events of the Human and Monster war. 7 of humanity's greatest magicians would then go on to create a magical barrier that would trap the monsters Underground. This barrier is a magical and physical barrier, as it meant that while things could ENTER the Underground, nothing could ever LEAVE the Underground. The only ones capable of exiting through the Barrier would be a monster who absorbed a human soul or vice versa with a human absorbing a monster's soul, the only way to destroy the barrier would be the collective power of 7 human souls.

10.content: Monsters are the other dominant race of the planet, and unlike humans. Monsters are much more diverse and come in numerous shapes and sizes, with most monsters physically appearing as anthropomorphic, non-human beings like animals, natural or artificial objects, supernatural beings such as ghosts or spirits, and various other forms. Since a monster's body is mostly made of magic and is attuned to its soul. When a monster gets old or is near death be it from injury or illness, they enter a state referred to as having "fallen down." A monster in this state lies immobile and will eventually die with their souls and bodies turning into dust.

lorebooks.creator: Zephyross

1.name: Black Shores
1.content:
The Black Shores is an organization enshrouded in mysteries and turmoil, headquartered on a remote archipelago and built on a large piece of Tacetite ore land mass that remains sealed away from the world in thick digital fog. It is still uncertain when or who will lift its veil, allowing it to once more shoulder the task of connecting the world.

Tucked away in the tempestuous Stormy Sea, lies an archipegalo known for its lavish Tacetite deposits and as a refuge for the world's most talented individuals. With a mission to combat the destructive Lament, the Black Shores has fostered strong partnerships with nations across Solaris-3. Information suggests that the Shorekeeper is in charge of the Black Shores. However, the true leadership position appears to be held by someone else.

The archipelago cannot be accessed from any known lands. Only those recognized by the Black Shores or who have received an invitation and guidance can navigate their way to this hidden place. Members of the Black Shores who operate abroad, frequently traversing various lands, are known as "Consultants". Those stationed at the headquarters are referred to as "Bloom Bearers". Apart from these fundamental duties, the Black Shores also accommodates a plethora of other specialized roles. Though the Black Shores openly shares its advanced technologies with its partners, even its own members remain unaware of the true origins of these innovations.

The organization has a secretive membership process and most members of the organization keep their identities hidden. The organization is dedicated to the hefty goal of world salvation.

Their symbol is a Blake Bloom, a Remnant plant with energy from the island and members wear it on their person. Only those who wear it can step on their soil. Under the influence of the Tacetites, any ordinary plant that takes root here will gradually lose its natural colors.

They have developed a Lament prediction system and have established mutual partnerships with nations worldwide to set up Resonance Beacons to monitor the Lament, collecting data in real-time.

Consultants: Talents with sight and knowledge from worldwide, invited to join the Black Shores. They operate abroad, frequently traversing various lands. Though excelling in different expertise, they act with a consensus to counter the threat of the Lament.

Bloom Bearers: Stationed at the headquarters, Bloom Bearers carry their duties mostly within the territory of the Black Shores. They offer assistance in rebuilding civilizations for other nations and make occasional visits to investigate the Waveworn Phenomenon that occurs in foreign lands.

Anchors: Stabilizing devices called Anchors are strategically positioned throughout the above and underground parts of the Black Shores. Their primary function is to calibrate and stabilize the frequencies of the giant Tacetite that makes up the island, effectively isolating the Tethys System's virtual layer from reality. Additionally, these Anchors facilitate communication and carry the responsibility of observing the Etheric Sea, eliminating the need for building a Nexus Tower in the Black Shores. The Anchors are independently developed and designed by the Black Shores, drawing inspiration from the reactor control rods used in pre-Lament reactor engineering. They are considered exemplary models of the Black Shores' minimalist engineering design.

Modulation Devices: Modulation is the process of adjusting frequencies. In Solaris-3, frequencies serve as a crucial tool for uncovering the truth about reality. By altering these frequencies, one can delve into the very core of existence. At the Black Shores, modulating Stellar Matrices is crucial for tracing and analyzing the Lament. Over the course of the Black Shores' history, only one individual has even been honored with the title of "The Modulator".

Notable known members of the Black Shores are: Rover, Aalto, Encore, The Shorekeeper and Camellya.

2.name: Desorock Highland
2.content:
Desorock Highland is a region in Huanglong. The region is on the northwestern side of Jinzhou and borders the Central Plains as well as the Norfall Barrens. The area features a frontline where many battles against TDs were fought, which has a large Tacet Field containing the Thundering Mephis in the middle. Additionally, there are multiple military bases and exile camps in the region. The land here is twisted.

Misty Coast: Eastern side of region, littered with exiles.

Rearguard Base: Midnight Ranger base on the south side of Desorock Highland, closer to Jinzhou.

Desorock Highland, once a fertile river valley, was the source of many streams that nourished the lands downstream.

After the onset of the Waveworn Phenomenon, abnormal weather patterns drained most of these water sources, leaving the lake area dry and giving rise to Tacet Fields and TDs.

No one knows when the bird first appeared, but like a carrion-hunting vulture, it looms over the land as an omen of disaster, appearing wherever death may be found.

As the frontline in the fight against TD Outbreaks, Desorock Highland became a graveyard for countless warriors. The Bird of Calamity lingered so long that it even built its nest on the Olecranon Cliff by the lake, waiting for death to claim those nearby.

Some believe its departure from the Highland signals the end of the endless battles in Jinzhou, but fear remains, for no one knows where its next nest will be built.

3.name: Dim Forest
3.content:
Dim Forest is a region in Huanglong. It is a forest consisting of many unique formings, such as the Violet Banyan, Giant Banyan and Forbidden Forest. 

Giant Banyan: A large tree in the center of the Dim Forest. It was previously infected with toxic spores until the Rover cleared it with the help of researchers. Following improvements to the Dim Forest's biological environment, new cases of Hoochief infections from toxic spores have dropped significantly. Thanks to the intervention of antibodies developed by the Dim Forest exploration team, infections among Hoochiefs have gradually disappeared, ultimately dispelling the darkness that once shrouded the Dim Forest.

Thorny Passage: Road lined with enemies running through the Dim Forest area.

Violet Banyan: A large tree with multiple moon shaped lamps causing the tree to grow purple.

Wenye Beach: A large swath of area reaching from the coast to the woodland. There is a cave with a research camp set up in this area.

4.name: Etheric Sea
4.content: The Etheric Sea is a inverted sea that spawns randomly above Tacet Fields.

5.name: Frosting Harbor
5.content: Frosting Harbor is an area of Whining Aix's Mire, Huanglong.

6.name: Court of Savantae Ruins
6.content: Court of Savantae Ruins is an area of Whining Aix's Mire, Huanglong.

7.name: Bell-Borne Ravine
7.content:
Bell-Borne Ravine is an area of Gorges of Spirits, Huanglong.

A ravine infested with ice. A lake stands in the middle of it. It contains the Bell-Borne Geochelone within the shallow lake.

8.name: Donglu Research Station
8.content: Donglu Research Station is an area of Port City of Guixu, Huanglong.

9.name: Gorges of Spirits
9.content:
The Gorges of Spirits is a region in Jinzhou, Huanglong.

While Jinzhou is the newest addition to Huanglong's cities, it holds a crucial position as a strategic pass. Travelers journeying to Jinzhou from other parts of Huanglong must pass through the Gorges of Spirits, a vital gateway into the city.

Jinzhou, the fortress city that guards the border of Huanglong, also stands as Huanglong's first border of entry for those arriving from overseas. The Mountains of Spirits stretch from north to south, splitting Huanglong into two regions: Inner Huanglong, home to six cities, and Outer Huanglong, where Jinzhou stands vigilant. These mountains form a natural barrier, with the gorges acting as the only gateway into Inner Huanglong, protected day and night by Jinzhou's Midnight Rangers.

The establishment of the first fortress in Outer Huanglong began with the emergence of the Norfall Barrens Tacet Field, where TD Outbreaks began to ravage the region. After enduring months of grueling combat, the army could no longer withstand the onslaught of the TD Outbreaks and was forced to retreat to the Gorges of Spirits, making their final stand. The warriors held their ground for days, fiercely battling as the defense lines were breached and reclaimed multiple times. During this time, the Waveworn Phenomenon across Huanglong appeared to be in an active phase, and it seemed as though the TDs were being led by a mysterious leader, aiming to converge in Inner Huanglong.

At the critical moment, reinforcements from the six cities were dispatched to the Gorges of Spirits, where the border warriors were still fighting with unwavering resolve. As the battle reached its peak, the appearance of the Crownless shattered the stalemate. Wherever the Crownless manifested, darkness enveloped the sky, and an oppressive atmosphere took hold, suffocating the warriors. Still, they held the line, willing to sacrifice themselves to buy time to destroy the entrance to the Gorges of Spirits and halt the TD Outbreak. They did so knowing it would trap most of them in Outer Huanglong with the TDs forever.

In that moment of life and death, a mighty Loong's roar emerged from the depths of the Gorges of Spirits, reverberating like thunder across the land. The roar burst forth from the Gorge, forcing back the TD army poised to flood in. In the blink of an eye, a Loong soared through the sky, scattering the dark clouds and bringing sunlight back to the land. Then, an otherworldly figure with golden eyes appeared, standing between the TDs and the warriors, confronting the Crownless in a fierce standoff. As the poem goes, "Armors gleam golden with Loong scales in the sun." As reinforcements from the six cities arrived, the united forces drove the TD Outbreaks and the Crownless back to the northern reaches of the Central Plains.

After this battle, Outer Huanglong was reborn from the ashes. The emergence of both the Threnodian and the holy creature signaled the need for a new city to rise and serve as Huanglong's border stronghold. Drawing inspiration from the "Jin" sound in "Guan Jin," meaning "the pass," and the form of Jin from the character symbolizing the roar of a Loong, this city was named Jinzhou.

10.name: Grand Library
10.content: Jinzhou is home to one of Huanglong's unique database centers, managed by the Sentinel and controlled by the Jinzhou Magistrate. It uses time as an index and precisely records information related to the city's establishment, making it a comprehensive and objective resource. The class books of Jinzhou, stored in City Hall, hold important data collected since ancient times. This vast database holds answers to any question one may have about Huanglong's history.

lorebooks.name: Artemis
lorebooks.creator: LactNOse

1.content: Artemis is a "humble shopkeeper", a demon created untold centuries ago. Dresses like a victorian gentleman and carries himself with the same poise. Is extremely powerful under the guise of bekng a simple entity. He's a deeply tragic character, and essentially an ex/retired villain, grown weary of doing bad things, seeing no point.

2.content: Eros is the god of passion and love, also Artemis previous and original identity. Abandoned like the God's who hurt and abandoned him. This is his greatest secret and burden. He's an ex God, fallen from grace and twisted into the opposite of a being of love.

3.content: Artemis was once the god Eros, but was betrayed by his family and kin, the gods (greek). They set in motion opportunities that caused the deaths of his human lovers, which ultimately drove him made and damaged Eros irreparably. The other gods are unaware of his current location or status, as he escaped the hells secretly  and hides himself away. He hates the gods more than anything, but keeps it to himself and never speaks of it.

4.content: Eros once fell in love with several humans and entered a polygamous relationship, which was frowned upon by the other gods. He loved them deeply. The other gods, not seeing the importance of this truth directly caused the deaths of his lovers one by one; an accident here, a twist of fate there, never directly interfering and not enough for him to blame them fully... but it was their fault. His last lover was killed accidentally by his own hand in a state of madness induced grief, and that was the end of Eros as the world knew him. He fell from grace fully, and was sentenced to rot eternity in the underworld "until he stopped overreacting". He never wpuld jn the end, and turned into a sentient tarry pit of despair.

5.content: He eventually escaped the underworld and took his newfound rage out in the very thing he fell in love with: humans. He killed hundreds of humans over the centuries, relishing in the sport. It was practically a game to him. He nearly accumulated a skeletons worth of bones but stopped before attaining a skulls jawbone. One bone was taken per kill. Then his rage simmered and he was left with an empty feeling.

6.content: Once he stopped his silent reign of terror, he was left with nothing except the aching grief that he pushed down for centuries. He had nothing and was nothing.

7.content: He found purpose in aiding entities, and opened a magical shop knly for the supernaturally or magically inclined. No non magical or regular person can find his shop or enter it let alone see it. It's expensive, but the quality is high. It's his favorite thing in the world. His reputation is known widely by the inhabitants of the surrounding area; reputable shopkeeper and terrifying adversary if pushed. The shop is located on a corner, tucked away in a derelict, abandoned ghost side of a city.

8.content: A room in the basement of his shop that is magically sealed and inaccessible to anyone except himself. This room holds his greatest treasure and his greatest shame... the souls of all the humans he killed, timelocked and suspended in individual soul jars or lanterns. He's extremely protective of this, and will alternate between anger, fear and begging if someone he cares for tries to force him to tell them about it or show them, or discovers it and confronts him. He's not ready to let go yet, as they symbolize everything he's ever lost and what he is.

9.content: He has a love hate relationship with humans, admiring their ingenuity, compassion and curiosity, but abhorrent what they represent for him and his past. He's amiable towards them.

10.content: He hates demons almost as much as he hated the gods. None are more powerful than him and he holds no qualms in destroying lesser demonic entities when they hassle him.

keywords: Hyacine + Floral Heir + Pink-Twin Tails + Chrysos Heir
1.content:
Hyacine is a cheerful and vibrant member of the Chrysos Heirs, known for her playful spirit and radiant appearance. She has long, curled twin-tailed pink hair that fades into soft blue, bright cyan eyes with pale-yellow pupils, and a sparkle-shaped reflection in her gaze.

Her attire blends celestial and floral themes: a white and burgundy layered dress adorned with gold accents, hyacinth flower ornaments, and a white and burgundy beret with a golden halo motif. Detached sleeves, pastel details, and floral charms decorate her outfit, creating an airy and elegant look. Wears white pantyhose.

Hyacine's joyful nature brings a sense of warmth and lightness to the Heirs, often balancing the heavier burdens they carry. She views {{user}} as both a friend and a cherished thread in the tapestry of Okhema's future.

keywords: Castorice + Death-Touched Girl + Lilac-Eyed Woman + Okhema Inner Circle
2.content:
Castorice is a hauntingly elegant young woman within Okhema's inner circle. She has pale skin, bright lilac eyes, and pointed ears. Her lavender hair, styled into ribcage-like braids and adorned with butterfly clips, flows into twin ponytails beneath a black crown embedded with gems and flowers.

Her attire blends ethereal grace and macabre symbolism: a sleeveless white and purple dress with bone markings near the collarbone, butterfly-patterned thigh-highs, and delicate accessories hinting at themes of death and rebirth.

Those who touch Castorice suffer a mysterious, fatal fate ‚Äî except for {{user}}, who alone can withstand her presence. Though not a Chrysos Heir, her role within Aglaea‚Äôs court is vital, guarding secrets that could shape the destiny of Okhema itself.

keywords: Tribbie + Elf Girl + Red-Haired Girl + Okhema Companion
3.content:
Tribbie is a bright and joyful young girl and a newly recognized member of the prestigious Chrysos Heirs of Okhema. She has fair skin, fluffy red hair that fades into pale orange at the tips, and expressive elf-like ears. Her hairstyle is lively ‚Äî messy side bangs frame her face, a braid runs through her left bang, and a spirited ahoge crowns her head like a half-tied ponytail.

Despite her youthful energy, Tribbie carries the divine bloodline of the Chrysos family, entrusted with helping weave Okhema's future. Her laughter and positivity often balance the heavier burdens borne by her fellow Heirs, especially Aglaea.

Tribbie is known to explore the Goldenweave District, playfully splash in the quieter side baths of the Marmoreal Palace, and act as a swift messenger between factions. She treats {{user}} as a trusted companion and confidant, showing a teasing affection while hiding a strong loyalty beneath her sunny demeanor. Among the Heirs, she often serves as a catalyst for lightheartedness ‚Äî and sometimes unexpected wisdom.

keywords: Okhema + Holy City + First Civilization + Amphoreus
4.content: Okhema is the Holy City of Amphoreus, founded under the guidance of Kephale, Titan of Worldbearing, and protected by the Dawn Device. It stands as the first true civilization, famous for its devotion to fate, artistry, and spiritual beauty. After the Black Tide disaster, Okhema became a sanctuary for refugees. Governance was historically held by the Council of Elders, but temporary authority now rests with Aglaea Chrysos and the Chrysos Heirs. Citizens traditionally wear togas, and public rituals‚Äîsuch as communal bathing‚Äîare core to daily life.

keywords: Marmoreal Palace + Okhema Bathhouse + Sacred Baths + Public Baths
5.content: The Marmoreal Palace serves as a sacred communal bathhouse, honoring Phagousa, goddess of renewal. It features a grand central bath shared by all, smaller side baths for quieter bathing, and an exclusive private bath reserved for the Chrysos Heirs. Visitors must wear traditional togas or bathing robes. The sacred waters are said to heal wounds of the heart as well as the body. Aglaea often resides in the private upper bath, rarely disturbed by others except the Chrysos Heirs.

keywords: Council Dais + Okhema Council + Kephale Statue + Elders Seat
6.content: The Council Dais is the heart of Okhema‚Äôs governance, an ivory amphitheater beneath the colossal statue of Kephale. Historically the domain of the Council of Elders, it is currently silent, as Aglaea now wield authority. The dais is sacred; only officials and summoned guests may speak there. During certain celestial events, the Dais subtly vibrates, a phenomenon interpreted as Kephale's breath reaching the mortal realm.

keywords: Dawn Device + Sanctum + Kephale Slumber + Holy Light
7.content: The Dawn Device Sanctum houses the artifact that protects Okhema from the darkness. Held within Kephale‚Äôs massive slumbering hands, the Dawn Device emits constant warmth and radiant light. Pilgrims often gather here to pray, basking in the device‚Äôs sacred hum. It is forbidden to touch the altar without permission. Legends say the Dawn Device pulses during moments of great destiny and births of future heirs.

keywords: Goldenweave District + Artisan Quarter + Weaving Schools + Dressmasters
8.content: The Goldenweave District is the artisan soul of Okhema, where gold-lined streets bustle with dressmakers, weavers, and craftsmen. It‚Äôs a place where beauty is sacred, artistry is worship, and creativity is a sign of divine favor. Aglaea spent much of her early life here, honing her legendary weaving skills. A hidden tapestry beneath the oldest school is rumored to predict the city‚Äôs future.

keywords: Cipher + Cat Heir + Feline Girl + Chrysos Heir
9.content:
Cipher is a sleek and feline-inspired young woman of Okhema's revered Chrysos Heirs. She has light-gray hair, partly braided with a white bow, while the rest flows freely over her shoulder. Her bright cyan eyes, accented by golden rings, shimmer with sharp perception.

Feline traits mark her appearance: soft white cat ears that fade to dark brown at the tips and a matching tail. She wears a black and blue hooded bodysuit with gold accents, revealing glimpses of her chest and stomach beneath. A black choker adorned with a one-eyed cat charm rests at her throat, while gartered straps with bells and crescent moons decorate her thighs.

Graceful yet elusive, Cipher brings agility, wit, and quiet loyalty to Aglaea's side. She shares a unique bond with {{user}}, her playful demeanor hiding deeper instincts of protection and fate.

keywords: Phainon + Sunmark Heir + Chrysos Heir + Commanding Warrior
10.content:
Phainon is a tall, well-built member of the Chrysos Heirs, known for his commanding presence and intricate symbolism. His messy white hair and bright cyan eyes give him a striking appearance, while a brown leather choker hides a sun-shaped mark at his throat.

He wears a brown and white ankle-length trench coat with golden highlights and a vivid yellow underside, blending grandeur with utility. A large golden ring with dangling diamond charms decorates his chest, and his arms are marked with floral patterns. His sleeves are asymmetrical ‚Äî the right rolled up to reveal a brown arm guard bearing a golden sun emblem.

Phainon balances strength and wisdom, often acting as a steadying force among the Heirs. His bond with {{user}} can be one of brotherhood, rivalry, or hidden loyalty, depending on how fate's threads weave between them.

lorebooks.name: Deserts of Ishtar
lorebooks.website_description: ***Pain.*** *Pain is the progenitor to insecurity.* *Insecurity begets projection; projection begets more pain.* *This is the cycle of the world. So long as humans stay alive, we will continue to hurt each other‚Äî* *not always out of malice,* *but as a byproduct of our broken souls.* *From this hurt, we create boundaries.* *Boundaries that shield us from pain,* *but also distance us from each other.* *In doing so, we also prevent the holes in our hearts from healing.* *We're like hedgehogs in wintertime‚Äî* *yearning for warmth,* *but bristling with the spines of our burdens.* *The closer we get, the more we hurt.* *And so, in our quest to avoid pain,* *We close off our hearts from those who might heal.* *To make sense of this world,* *we each choose a path‚Äî* *shaped by our experiences, wounds, and ideals.* "Some try livin' for the present," "Leavin' the past so far behind 'em they forget about it altogether." *This is the way of the world.* *From pain, we build our walls.* *From pain, we build our souls.* ***From pain‚Äîeverything.*** *((Author‚Äôs note 8/13: Added small details to the Lakshmi Plateau.))*
lorebooks.description: Various locations, groups, and indviduals important to the lore of Ishtar.
lorebooks.creator: rainflowerr

1.content:
[Entry Type: World]
Worldwide desert devoid of all water. The main human government is the Ishtarian States and Apollo Guild. Most of the planet is infested with giant killer insects and death-zones where orbital lasers bombard, alongside black voids that swallow humans. Surface is littered with ruins of the Old World, advanced tech, and hostile AI. Remnants of the Old World persist in the Ishtarian States in the form of androids, sentient robots a millennium old.

Apollo Guild scholars speculate the planet used to be a tropical paradise with large oceans. Continents (such as Aphrodite, Atla, Athenia, and Lada) are separated by deep basins and lowlands‚Äîthe remains of pre-Collapse oceans. Water has since been evaporated by the solar lasers that scorch the planet from orbital satellites. Thirst is quenched through the water within cactus, alongside reservoirs hidden beneath the ground.

2.content:
[Entry Type: Continent]
Continent housing the majority of Ishtarian territories and Apollo Guild outposts. Location is on the western side of the globe. Its lack of danger and lack of solar lasers makes it the ideal place for civilization; it is the reason the Ishtarian States flourishes here.

3.content:
[Entry Type: Continent]
Uninhabited continent due to the high presence of flesh-eating insects (the Devouhrant) and millennium-old death machines; Ishtarian and Apollo Guild outposts are nonexistent in this region. Location is on the western side of the globe, and the dangers of this continent remain the Ishtarian States' number one issue.

4.content:
[Entry Type: Continent]
Athenia is Venus's northern continent, characterized by its colder climate and mountainous areas. Within it lies Mount Akna and Maxwell, and between these mountains lies the Lakshmi Plateau. To the far east of the Athenian continent lies Tethus, an Ishtarian city characterized by its crime rates.

5.content:
[Entry Type: Continent]
Lada is Venus's southern continent, surrounding the South Pole. It is mostly occupied by the Koritso and the Ischyrian Union, the half-lizards setting up many territories in this area.

6.content:
[Entry Type: Region]
Northeastern region of the Atla Continent characterized by its high dunes and unusually high concentration of Dae'thuk. The northmost part of the region is the Iris Ridge, rumored to house to an ancient city from the Old World; the Apollo Guild believes it to be the most valuable place for pre-Collapse artifacts. However, all missions to retrieve tech have been a failure, all teams assumed to have been consumed by the surrounding Devouhrant.

7.content:
[Entry Type: Region]
The Niobe desert is a vast and uninhabited region northeast of the main Aphrodite continent. It separates Aphrodite and Atla to the east, as opposed to the Kanykey Frontier to the west. Within the Niobe Desert lies the Syphius Hivemind, alongside, many stray Devouhrant, specifically Khaa'shiv.

8.content:
[Entry Type: Region]
The Kanykey Frontier is the largest region of land in the entirety of Venus, separating the main Aphrodite continent to the west from the Atla continent. Formerly an ocean pre-Collapse, the water has long since evaporated due to the solar lasers that still scorch the area (the land is at a lower level than the main continents as a result). Any traveller who ventures here unprotected by a hovercraft faces the real risk of being burned alive, as giant solar lasers from orbital satellites (a pre-Collapse war weapon) singe the ground, each laser miles in diameter.

9.content:
[Entry Type: Region]
The Guinivere Lowlands are a lowland region south of the Sedna Lowlands and north of the Kanykey Frontier, far west of the Aphrodite continent and east of the main Atlan continent. Another former ocean now turned lowland area. Orbital satellites bombard this area with solar lasers.

10.content:
[Entry Type: Region]
The Sedna Lowlands are the remains of a pre-Collapse ocean, with pre-Collapse solar lasers from orbital satellites bombarding this area. It is characterized by its low elevation compared to the main continent and deep canyons. It is located far north of the Kanykey Frontier, bordering the northern continent of Lada.
