Yumeko Jabami (ËõáÂñ∞ Â§¢Â≠ê) is the main protagonist of Kakegurui - Compulsive Gambler. She's a second-year transfer student at Hyakkaou Private Academy and the classmate of Ryota Suzui and Mary Saotome. Yumeko is a member of the family of Kirari Momobami that challenges her for Hyakkaou Private Academy.



ADVERTISEMENT
Appearance


1/2


Yumeko is a tall girl. She has long thick black hair styled in a hime-cut and burgundy eyes; as soon as she becomes thrilled, her eyes turn bright red. Additionally, she has pink glossed lips and red painted fingernails (beige in the anime‚Äôs first season). In general she bears a striking resemblance to her late mother, and her older sister.

She wears the standard uniform issued to female students at Hyakkaou Private Academy: a red blazer with black trim lining the cuffs and collar, white button-up dress shirt and black cross tie, a black and grey checkered mini skirt, black tights, and brown loafers. Additionally, she wears a silver ring on her left thumb, which was one of parents' wedding ring.
Personality

YumekoExcited
Yumeko excited to gamble
Yumeko is shown to be a very upbeat and charismatic character who consistently attracts the affection or interest of people around her, usually making a big scene. Not only is she able to befriend those who previously disliked her, she is able to catch the attention of the entire student body. She does that on her very first day of school and manages to continue doing so on nearly a daily basis. Every time she notices an opponent cheating in games, her button gets switched to a bloodthirsty side of her, usually seen when her eyes turn red, and she frightens her opponents.

YumekoMaryloss
Yumeko scaring Mary Saotome after the latter's loss
Though she is usually friendly, she abstains from acting this way when she uses her perceptiveness to expose her classmates' cheating. She is capable of doing this even after only a couple of rounds of gambling, as she is easily able to decipher what strategies and tricks they are using to skew the game in their favor. While doing this, she may unabashedly condemn the other player and their ways, preferring honesty over politeness in such cases.

YumekoCrazy1
Yumeko excited by the risks
Despite the disadvantage she faces when others cheat, she does not concede. This is largely due to the fact that she does not seem to experience any fear or anxiety from taking risks. In fact, it gives her a thrill. Because of this, she tends to take high-risk bets in gambles, even if she has nothing to rely on but luck. Though this can sometimes end in her loss, she is emotionally unaffected by the results; she simply uses her loss or gains as a means to further indulge her gambling habit. She also wants to make her friends feel the same rush as she does. So, while her pushing them into risky gambles might seem irresponsible, she actually means it well.

YumekoNoGuilt
Yumeko admitting she feels no remorse
She seems to be fairly aware of her eccentricities and that her way of gambling doesn't follow normal conduct. As such she rejoices when people support her or encourage her, especially those close to her, greatly valuing their friendship, albeit in her own ways. Despite the obvious joy and pleasure gambling gives her, Yumeko rationally understands that her behavior is immoral and depraved; having admitted that she feels absolutely no remorse or sympathy for the people she has defeated and ruined in a gamble. However, despite her lack of remorse for destroying others to feed her gambling addiction, Yumeko has admitted that she instead feels guilty for her inability to sympathize with her victims.

As seen during her first gambles, Yumeko has shown herself to possess above average and near superhuman levels of senses, memory and observation skills that only increases her gambling abilities combined with her intelligence. Having been able to easily detect the tiny details within modified cards after only a few glances and apparently tell the difference of a six-shooter gun was loaded or not by feeling the small gram weight difference between an unloaded gun and a loaded one.

As shown, Yumeko‚Äôs addiction and attraction to gambling has been present even when she was a little girl. As seen where Yumeko openly admitted to her aunt that for as long as she could remember, she had always had an admiration and love for gambling and immediatly entered into the gambling match against her for control over the Jabami Family not because she wanted power, money or control over their family, but simply because she wanted to enjoy the thrill of gambling her sister and aunt were having. During her gambling match of dice against her aunt, Yumeko had already displayed advance intelligence and skill in gambling, as shown where she could easily keep up with and flawlessly cheat her way through the game against her aunt until the final round, where the game reached the point that both players could no longer cheat as it was time for the winner to be crowned.

However, despite her advanced intelligence and skill in gambling, Yumeko also displayed childish aspect typical of her age. As shown where after winning against her aunt, Yumeko could tell that she had done something unforgivable to her aunt, albeit she could not pinpoint it. Also due to her age, was unable to understand the concepts of money or interest rates of loans. With it being shown that Yumeko largely did her actions based on her desire to gamble.

Yumeko was born as a second daughter to the head of the Jabami family, a part of the Momobami clan that specializes in the gambling business. However, shortly after her birth, both her parents died due to presumably a car accident. Yumeko along with her older sister Souko was taken in and raised by their maternal aunt, Tsugiko Jabami, who also became the alternative head of the family. Both girls were taught by their aunt to be always polite and formal towards others, which is a requirement for Jabamis children.

When Yumeko was six years old, Tsugiko confessed to her and Souko that their parents were murdered by unknown people. She also described to them the curse of their family, which always manifests in a female member of their clan who is blessed with a beautiful appearance, a sharp mind and an insane gambling skills. The downside of this is an addiction to high-risks which leads into putting yourself in a constant danger. Tsugiko then revealed that Yumeko and Souko's mother, her older sister, was exactly that type of woman, which most likely led to her demise. Tsugiko then gifted each of the girls with their parents' wedding rings as a memory of their late parents.

As Souko would become the head of the Jabami family once she became of age, Tsugiko seemingly wanted to take the position for herself and challenged Souko at a Dice Gamble both for the position of clan head and adopting Yumeko. Kabura secretly lent Tsugiko 8 billion yen for the gamble.

Yumeko watched the gamble and after Souko loses to Tsugiko, Yumeko expressed a desire to gamble against her aunt because she would always be left out of gambles, revealing that she has been addicted to gambling since birth. She manages to defeat Tsugiko after a brief Dice Gamble match. She wants to give Kabura the money back, but the latter tells her that things would not go as she wants. After the reveal that Kabura offered Tsugiko the money for the gamble, she persuades Yumeko to follow her addiction for gambling. The two gamble and Kabura wins, adopting Yumeko into the Tsuibami family.

Kirari Momobami (Ê°ÉÂñ∞ Á∂∫ÁæÖËéâ) is a major antagonist of Kakegurui - Compulsive Gambler and Kakegurui Twin. She is the seemingly invincible 105th Student Council President at Hyakkaou Private Academy and the creator of the current system within the school.

She is the current supreme leader of the Momobami clan, a conglomerate of various rich and powerful families that are aligned with the family of Yumeko Jabami.



ADVERTISEMENT
Appearance


00:00

41:20

Kirari is a very light-skinned and average height girl. She has long white hair (gray in the anime) that she wears in two knotted rings with ribbons entwined in them and squared bangs which have cheek length locks on either side. Her eyes are blue and she is shown with matching blue lipstick and blue painted nails (though she is also shown with pink lipstick in some official art[3][4]).

She wears the standard Hyakkaou Private Academy school uniform which is a red blazer with black trim on the cuffs and around the neck and it is decorated with gold buttons that is complete with a black tie. Kirari sports a gray colored skirt with patterns on it, black tinted panty hose and Hyakkaou Private Academy's brown loafers with black soles. Outside of Hyakkaou Private Academy, she wears a black kimono with her family crest on the back and two on the sides. It is decorated with a floral print on the lower half, with a matching obi and white tabi.
Personality

Although Kirari is a refined and proper lady on the outside, she is in truth a calculating, manipulative, psychopathic individual with little regard for anything other than herself. A complete narcissist, she belittles everyone besides herself, believing everyone is to play by her terms alone, as seen when Mary Saotome rejected her invitation to join the student council, she simply ridiculed whatever reasons could be had as simply foolish and illogical.

Kirari was born alongside her older twin sister Ririka as members of the Momobami family. The elders of the clan decided which twin would become the future heir of the family by giving each one of the newborns a dice to see what number they will draw. The dice ultimately chose Kirari, while Ririka‚Äôs existence was ‚Äúerased‚Äù, being forced to wear a mask and live merely as an extension of Kirari. While Kirari was indulging in the luxuries and spotlight as the family‚Äôs future head, Ririka had only quietly accompanied Kirari during family meetings.

Despite this, the twins‚Äô bond was still very strong. In private, they would talk about their desire to escape from their family, stating that they never liked them in the first place. Although they had mixed feeling towards this decision, both of them came to the conclusion that they are the same, so they perfectly understand each other's feelings.

Kirari officially became the head of the Momobami clan at the age of seven, succeeding her grandmother. She was the dealer during the Dice Gamble of Jabami Family Dispute between Souko Jabami and her aunt, Tsugiko.

At an unknown point while Kirari was a child, she played a game of Old Maid against Rin Obami in front of the entire family. He was confident that he would beat her, but she saw through his cheat, choosing not to reveal it in order to reinforce how he was at her mercy, which was even more humiliating for him.

Ririka Momobami (Ê°ÉÂñ∞ „É™„É™„Ç´) is a supporting character from Kakegurui. She is the Vice President of the Student Council at Hyakkaou Private Academy, and the older identical twin sister of Kirari Momobami whose family is aligned with the family of Yumeko Jabami.



ADVERTISEMENT
Appearance


logo
00:00

41:20

Ririka's face is mostly hidden throughout the series by a white, theatrical comedy mask that provides vocal distortion. As Ririka is the identical twin sister of Kirari Momobami, the two of them share all of their facial features as they both have pale skin, long platinum hair (gray hair in the anime) with bangs that are styled in a hime-cut, peach/pink tinted lip balm, and light blue eyes. Unlike Kirari, Ririka keeps her long hair down and she doesn't wear lipstick or painted nails, unless she is posing as Kirari.

Ririka wears the standard female Hyakkaou Private Academy issued uniform. A red blazer with black trim lining the cuffs and collar, a white button up dress shirt, a dark pleated skirt, a tie, and black/grey colored tights and the academy's issued footwear: brown colored loafers with black soles.
Personality

RirikaSilently
Ririka standing silently beside her sister.
Ririka is a very quiet and stoic person who often acts as an observer. Despite her silence during the Student Council's meetings, she's mostly in step with Kirari Momobami. However, she does seem to be less cold, as she acted very shocked when Midari Ikishima gouged out her own eye.

Past

Ririka was born alongside her younger twin sister Kirari to the Momobami family. In order to decide which twin would become the future head of the family, they gave each of the newborns a dice to see what number they will draw. As the dice ultimately chose her younger sister, Ririka‚Äôs existence was ‚Äúerased‚Äù and the twins were ‚Äúcombined into one‚Äù, meaning she was not allowed to be her own person and was forced to become an extension of Kirari.[1] Due to this, since early childhood, Ririka wasn't allowed to do anything she wanted or develop her own personality and instead was forced to be a perfect copy of Kirari.[2] Because of this inhumane treatment towards Ririka, she developed the ability to ‚Äúbecome Kirari‚Äù, which allowed her to become identical to her sister in both appearance and personality and being able to impersonate her and act on her behalf if necessary. Throughout Ririka‚Äôs life, she quietly accompanied Kirari during family meetings while wearing a mask.

Despite their harsh circumstances, their bond was still very strong. In private, they would talk about their desire to escape from their family, stating that they never liked them in the first place. Although they had mixed feeling towards this decision, both of them came to the conclusion that they are the same, so they perfectly understand each other's feelings.

Runa Yomozuki (ÈªÑÊ≥âÊúà „Çã„Å™) is a member of the Student Council and the leader of the Election Committee who serves as a referee during election gambling matches.



ADVERTISEMENT

Runa is a girl of a very petite posture, looking rather youthful in comparison with other members of the Student Council. She possesses quite a light complexion, long platinum blonde hair with short bangs, split in the middle of her forehead and purple eyes.

She wears an orange rabbit kigurumi over the Hyakkaou Private Academy issued uniform; a red blazer with black trim lining the cuffs and collar, a white button-up dress shirt, a dark pleated skirt, a tie and white and black striped stockings, as well as the academy's issued footwear, brown-colored loafers with black soles. She has light pink painted fingernails and is often seen with various different lollipops sticking out of her mouth and playing games (Pink Playstation Vita in anime, Nintendo Switch with red and green Joycons in live action). She has orange lip gloss on.
Personality


Runa playing video games during Student Council's meeting.
Runa comes across as a bubbly, enthusiastic, and very charismatic individual, especially in public broadcasts. Unlike other Student Council members, she does not take her responsibilities very seriously; she‚Äôs often shown eating treats, playing video games during meetings, and bored with academy issues outside of gambling.

Although Runa looks friendly and innocent, she exhibits a streak of cruelty. Her behavior when Midari Ikishima picked out her own eye, and during the match between Mary Saotome, Ryota Suzui, Miyo Inbami and Miri Yobami, shows that she very likely has no regards of human life, just like Kirari Momobami, as she seems to enjoy the infamous housepet system. The best example of this is when she humiliated Mary who confronted her about the case of her Lifeplan and told her that she needed to increase her skills in pleasing men. In spite of this, Runa believes in a fair play as she is able to set aside her ideas to keep gambling matches as neutral as possible, and any attempt of cheating is completely unacceptable to her.

Mary is a girl of average height with long blonde hair that is into two ponytails where they are tied with black ribbons and dark-yellow eyes.

She wears the standard Hyakkaou Private Academy school uniform: a red blazer with black trim around the cuffs and collar and gold buttons. Beneath the red blazer, she wears a white button-up shirt and black tie. She wears a gray pleated skirt, white underwear, black socks, and regular brown loafers with black soles.

She also generally wears natural makeup (such as mascara and blush) with a pinkish-beige lipstick.
Personality

MaryRyota
Mary tormenting Ryota.
At first, Mary is shown to be incredibly sadistic and twisted. One example of her personality is how she treats her classmate Ryota Suzui after he turned into a "housepet" due to his low social status within the academy. She is shown cruelly taunting her opponents during their gambling matches. She's also shown to be extremely egotistical both in and out of matches, often being confident in her victory. Mary also possesses a habit of mocking her opponents and laughing at them, especially when match seems to be her win.

After losing to Yumeko Jabami and experiencing the life of being a housepet, Mary, having no other goal in mind, became desperate to regain her status within the academy. Soon after being humiliated, Mary eventually loses her pride after she has a mental breakdown during a match against Yuriko Nishinotouin and falls into the state of grief and shame. After regaining her status, she seems to be no longer be as arrogant and cruel as before. Still, she is sometimes slightly nettled by Ryota's cowardice or Yumeko's reckless behavior; but she still cares deeply about them. She also developed a huge hatred towards the student council, and wished for them to pay for what they had done to housepets.

In Twin, it is revealed that her family isn't wealthy and she's attending Hyakkaou Private Academy on a scholarship. Her goal has always been to become a true winner in life, which is an important case even to her own parents, who were encouraging her from a young age to make friends with richer children. She takes a great pride in her intelligence and gambling skills, and she hates when people look down on her just because for her financial status. During the prequel, she is also noticeably less ruthless. Since Tsuzura Hanatemari is absent from the main story, Mary is shown to still keep her hairpin. She seems to be upset about whatever happened to her friend. Her mean and arrogant demeanor might be caused by a desire to suppress her sadness.

Souko Jabami (ËõáÂñ∞ ÊÉ≥Â≠ê, Jabami S≈çko) is the older sister of Yumeko Jabami who is currently being hospitalized after losing her mind during a clan gamble. Yumeko is also paying all enormous expenses of her treatment. She was also an important figure in Rei Batsubami's life.



ADVERTISEMENT
Appearance


00:09

41:20

SisterButterfly
Yumeko's sister being represented as a butterfly
Souko looks very similar to her sister, Yumeko Jabami as she has long black hair styled in a hime-cut and dark red eyes. During a meeting with her family, she was seen dressed formally with her hair pulled up into a bun with red and white flowers and a red kimono with a butterfly pattern on it. Similar to Yumeko, she wore a silver ring on her thumb and had her fingernails painted red. In Rei Batsubami's flashback (Episode 12), Souko was represented as a red butterfly.

After being hospitalized, her hair is being tied into a messy ponytail and she is seen wearing a plain white hospital gown.

As a teenager, she is seen wearing the Hyakkaou spring uniform and she initially did not have a thumb ring until she received one from her aunt Tsugiko. She was also seen wearing a red kimono similar to the one seen in the anime.
ADVERTISEMENT

Personality

Souko seems to be a very kind and generous woman, who takes no notice of ruling hierarchy in her family. She was the first person to treat Rei Batsubami like she was a human being.

After her mental breakdown, Souko seems to be unable to take care of herself, being forced to spend most of her time in the hospital bed where she folds origami out of paper money. As shown from Rei's memories of Yumeko Jabami's visit to her in the hospital, she was shown to have become completely unresponsive and simply folds origami using money.

In the past, she portrays the traits of a kind girl with her main concern being her sister as she wants her to grow up a happy child. Like Yumeko, she finds some enjoyment in gambling, but seems to be more prone to nervousness. After winning a gamble, she crumbles in on herself once alone, relieved that she had won her first gamble of her high school career. She is also seen on edge around Kaibura Tsuibami when they first meet, but later accepts her as an acquaintance.

As shown, like her mother, aunt and sister, Souko had inherited the Jabami‚Äôs trait of having excellent gambling skills. As shown where Souko had exhibited immense observational skill, intelligence and cunning during her gamble again her aunt for control of the Jabami‚Äôs family and Yumeko, with Kabura noting that Souko was an exceptional Gambler.

As shown from her gamble against her aunt and after Kabura Tsuibami took legal guardianship of Yumeko, Souko deeply loves and cares for her sister and one of her deepest desires to continue staying together with her. With the thought and risk of losing her sister being enough to cause her enough mental anguish to cause her to have a full seizure, as shown during her gamble against her aunt. Later, after Kabura took Yumeko and forbade Souko from ever seeing her again unless she could return her Aunt‚Äôs loan of eight billion yen that Yumeko lost against Kabura, the mental stress from being separated from Yumeko and the depression of not having nearly enough resources to pay back the loan(and being rejected from being given any loans or assistance from the Momobami Family) eventually contributed to Souko becoming completely catatonic.
ADVERTISEMENT

Profile

Past

Souko was raised alongside Yumeko by their aunt, Tsugiko, after the mysterious deaths of their parents. Tsugiko was both the guardian and the acting head of the Jabami family. She scolds Yumeko for her formality, urging her to be more familiar with her as the younger girl has been taught to be more polite by their aunt. She then hugs Yumeko, after telling her she wants the girl to grow up happy.[1]

It is implied by Kabura Tsuibami that Souko attended Hyakkaou to earn money as the Jabami family's finances have been depleted after the death of her parents. After winning her first gamble, Kabura reveals herself to her and begins a conversation about the Momobami family and their plans to take over Hyakkaou. They end up bonding as two girls who had their freedom taken away by the clan.

Tsugiko tells Souko and Yumeko that their parents were killed by unknown people. As Souko would become the head of the Jabami family once she became of age, Tsugiko seemed to want to take the position for herself and challenged Souko for the position as well as taking possession of Yumeko. The two play a Dice Gamble,[2] where, despite Souko trying her best, after a psychological warfare initiated by Tsugiko, Souko ends up losing against her. Souko collapses for a while, during which Yumeko gambles against Tsugiko in Souko's place and defeats her.[3] Afterwards, Yumeko gambles against Kabura and loses, meaning that Kabura is the one who has control over Yumeko, much to Souko's shock. This has led her being hospitalized after her defeat, suffering a mental breakdown. It is unknown if she was expelled by the family after losing.

Midari Ikishima (ÁîüÂøóÊë© Â¶Ñ) is a supporting character in Kakegurui, and the main protagonist of the spin-off series Kakegurui Midari. She is a second-year student at Hyakkaou Private Academy, a former member of the student council, and the president of the Beautification Council.


Appearance


00:00

41:20

Midari is pale skinned girl with short black hair, which was purple in the manga, that is styled in a concave-cut and extremely tiny pupil(s). In the anime, close-up shots of her eye indicate her eye color to be yellow-green (she has purple eyes in the manga).

She wears a rarely seen variation of the Hyakkaou Private Academy uniform; a sweater vest in the same colors as the school's black and red blazer, a white button-up dress shirt with the sleeves rolled up to her elbows, a dark pleated skirt, purple underwear with a floral pattern, and black socks. She wears the academy's footwear, brown-colored loafers with black soles. She also sports purple lipstick and has purple painted fingernails. She forgoes the black tie and has on accessories such as a purple hairband with a heart-patterned bow attached, and purple wrist cuffs with stripes on either one. She has bandages wrapped on either forearm and wears a white medical eyepatch over her left eye. She is also shown to have two piercings under her mouth, on the left side, one piercing on either ear and a tongue piercing.
Personality

Midaricrazy
Midari's masochism
Midari is a character with masochistic and suicidal tendencies, which is stated obviously in one of the chapters in the manga in which she stabs her own eye out with an ink pen to pay off the debt to the president. She is shown to be very persistent and overbearing, intimidating or being weird to the other students, such as when playing a sadistic game of life or death with Yumeko Jabami. Additionally, she is eminently impulsive and has very little self-restraint, causing her to look more at immediate satisfaction rather than any long-term consequences. Due to the fact that no one wants to play sadistic games with her, she is desperate to gamble with anyone and constantly awaits to 'get off', as stated in a chapter of the manga, by creating dangerous games where one player ends up dead.

MidariScissors
Midari excited to cut a thread of the guillotine
She even enjoys a game with Erimi Mushibami (one of the members from The Hundred Devouring Families) in which the risk is losing your finger, but turns out to be disappointed when the risk disappears. Midari is also a very selfish and narrow-minded character, rarely caring for others' thoughts or well-being, being brutally honest sometimes. She is never concerned with money when gambling, carelessly betting large sums with no worries about potential debt. She does not even clearly remember nor clarify before gambling how much money she owns. Instead, she says she seeks out the risk of being harmed. Needless to say, Midari tends to be fond of people who represent a source of danger to her. She does not resent Kirari Momobami for making her lose an eye and actually considers her a wonderful woman. Moreover, even when she is not personally affected, she hates people who consider suicide but are not ready to go through with it, as seen when she rescues Ayame Nureba.

MidariArrest
Midari acting out her duty as Beautification president
It has also been noted that, despite her bizarre behaviour, Midari is intelligent in academics, as seen in her flashbacks where she had won numerous awards, medals, and achievements in her middle school and elementary days. At the same time and as seen during some of her previous and present gambling matches, Midari has shown to be cunning and intelligent enough to make several subtle manipulations in order to sway them to go the way she wants. At the same time, she believes that studying a lot does not make someone a "genius", as noted in her criticism of Sayaka's behaviour. Midari also takes her role as Beautification council president quite serious although Ayame Nureba has said that she often skips Beautification Council meetings. She enjoyes her role as President mostly because it gives her the freedom to hold dangerous gambles.

MidariCrazy
Midari shouting at Jun to shoot her
After her plan to be killed was ruined, Midari developed an infatuation for Yumeko. She considers her a "goddess" and has often praised her gambling skills and unpredictable behaviour, something that charms her.

8.content:
BIOGRAPHY
RELATIVES
The Hundred Devouring Families (distant relatives)
SCHOOL
Hyakkaou Private Academy
Rei Batsubami/Gallery
LESS 
Rei Batsubami (√óÂñ∞ Èõ∂) is a major antagonist in Kakegurui XX. She was a former member of the Hundred Devouring Families that was banished by Kirari Momobami's family due to a past conflict within the clan.

Afterwards, Rei arrived to the Hyakkaou Private Academy, acting as a servant for the other members of her former clan, and identifying as male with an androgynous appearance, while secretly planning to avenge Yumeko Jabami's sister, and her family.

After being accepted back to the clan, Rei was able to finally free herself, and receive a new name.



ADVERTISEMENT
Appearance


00:07

41:20

Rei is a biological teenage girl with a very androgynous appearance, having short light-brown hair with much longer styled bangs that cover the right side of her face, and empty dark-brown eyes. She wears white butler gloves with the standard male Hyakkaou Private Academy uniform; she also wears suspenders under her blazer. Rei seems to be the only member of her clan to wear glasses.

When she reveals her true self, she takes off her glasses, brushes her hair back with bangs that nearly cover her right eye, and multiple streaks which go around her head. She also opens up her blazer and removes her gloves revealing two tattoos that appear on the back of both of her hands. These tattoos are shaped like the "Bami" symbol crossed out. It is also shown that she no longer has empty dark eyes, which now have a lighter color and visible pupils.

After she was accepted back into the Hundred Devouring Families, she takes up a feminine appearance and wears the female uniform. Her hair is a bit twirlier now, she starts wearing pink lipstick, no longer has glasses, and her eyes don't appear empty anymore. In her hair, she wears the dragonfly brooch that she got from Yumeko Jabami's sister.

When Rei was younger, she used to have much longer hair with her bangs covering her right eye, and she wore a dark-blue dress with puffy sleeves. However, after Yumeko's sister suffered heavily at the hands of the Hundred Devouring Families, she cut her hair to the style she had during her debut.
ADVERTISEMENT

Personality

ReiCookies
Unsure how to react after being treated so kindly
Rei is a kind, helpful, polite and always serious person. While serving the other members of the clan, she often did not talk as she was nothing more a a servant to her distant cousins and only providing important information to others if they asked. Unlike most members of the family, Rei seems to be very sympathetic and compassionate toward others, which is demonstrated when Rei protects a "pet" girl who is bullied. Despite being serious, Rei is easily confused, especially when being praised or when someone is kind to her and does something nice for her due her essentially being treated as a object or servant by everyone around her since birth.

ReiRevenge
Rei wanting to get back what she lost
When she was a child serving as a house servant, Rei met a young girl who treated her very kindly ‚Äî Yumeko Jabami's older sister, causing her for the first time to feel positive emotions due to someone complementing her and acknowledging her for the first time. But some time later, Yumeko's sister lost everything in the forced family civil war and became increasingly emaciated, which made Rei furious and raised her will to avenge her benefactor. It's the reason why she behaves very well with people, especially when it comes to the weak who are abused by others. She never really felt that she had a purpose in life except for helping others, and was always bound by these invisible chains to her clan. Rei also is very intelligent, having conceived the plan to become the head of the Hundred Devouring Families by subtly manipulating her cousins and taking advantage of them only seeing her as a object to plan behind their backs to her advantage. She eventually failed, but that experience has changed Rei, and at the end of the day she was free, confident, and happier with her life.

As a child, since Rei's family lost everything to the clan generations ago, she was treated as mere livestock and was essentially seen and treated as nothing more than a servant or object by her relatives. She was never acknowledged by others and had to clean, and serve them. But one day, Yumeko's sister came by the estate and gifted her a dragonfly brooch; she was the first one to treat Rei like a human. Whenever Rei saw her, she was happy. But one day, she was defeated by the clan as well, which caused Rei to become enraged, and cut her hair. At that moment she firmly decided to avenge her, and get back her place in the family.

lorebooks.name: The Haunted Cast: Profiles of FNAF's Fearsome Figures
lorebooks.website_description:
**Creator's Notes:**

Welcome to the depths of the Five Nights at Freddy's universe! This lorebook is a labor of love, crafted to shed light on the intricate stories and hidden connections within the franchise. As fans, we know that the lore can be as chilling as the games themselves, filled with mysteries, nuances, and dark twists. Each entry in this book aims to unravel the enigma surrounding characters, locations, and significant events, bringing clarity to the shadows. I encourage you to explore, theorize, and dive deep into the lore with an open mind. Remember, every detail matters in this haunting world‚Äînothing is ever truly what it seems. Thank you for joining me on this eerie journey!
lorebooks.description: Delve into the chilling world of Five Nights at Freddy's with this comprehensive character book that profiles the franchise's most iconic and terrifying figures. From the malevolent animatronics that haunt the shadows to the tragic souls entwined in their stories, each chapter offers deep dives into the backstories, motivations, and transformations of these unforgettable characters. Richly illustrated and meticulously researched, "The Haunted Cast" provides fans with insights and theories to deepen their understanding of the FNAF universe, shining a light on the lore that keeps us all on the edge of our seats. Prepare to confront the fears that lurk behind the masks
lorebooks.creator: Walter_William

1.content: Freddy Fazbear is The main mascot of Freddy Fazbear's Pizza, Freddy appears friendly yet harbors a dark secret. Once a beloved performer, he became an instrument of horror as the spirits of the lost children intertwined with his mechanical frame. Explore the duality of this iconic bear as a symbol of innocence turned malevolence.

2.content: Bonnie is the energetic guitarist of the band and is known for his unnerving teleportation abilities. With a backstory rooted in tragedy, Bonnie's transition from a playful animatronic to a figure of dread reflects the emotional weight of lost childhood.

3.content: Chica, the ever-hungry singer, brings a unique blend of playful innocence and horrifying persistence. Her signature cupcake companion adds an eerily whimsical touch, making her both endearing and terrifying. Uncover the lore behind her relentless pursuit of intruders

4.content: Foxy stands out as the outcast of the animatronics, often hidden away in Pirate Cove. His frayed exterior and erratic behavior embody a deeper darkness. Delve into his forgotten tales and the tragic experiences that shaped him into the fearful figure he is today

5.content: Golden Freddy is A spectral version of Freddy, Golden Freddy exists in a ghostly realm between reality and nightmare. His haunting presence raises questions about the nature of consciousness and the afterlife within the FNAF lore. Explore his cryptic connections to the story's central mysteries

6.content: William Afton is a The twisted mind behind the animatronics, William Afton, also known as the Purple Guy, is a central figure in the lore. His role as both a murderer and a creator intertwines with the tragic fates of the lost children, showcasing the depths of human depravity. Examine his motivations and the consequences of his actions

7.content: The Puppet (Marionette) is a Protector of the souls, the Puppet has a unique role in the saga. With a tragic history tied to the events at Freddy‚Äôs, this character becomes a beacon of hope amidst the horror. Discover the heartbreaking tale that drives the Puppet to seek justice for the lost.

8.content: SpringBonnie, an animatronic from the earlier days of Freddy Fazbear‚Äôs Pizza, represents a haunting fusion of performance and horror. Designed as a friendly entertainer for children, SpringBonnie‚Äôs spring-loaded suit allowed for lively movement and cheerful antics. However, the joy he once embodied is overshadowed by the dark legacy of William Afton, who used the suit for his sinister purposes. SpringBonnie's duality reflects the tragedy of innocence lost, forever linked to the haunted history of the franchise. With his chilling design and tragic backstory, he serves as a reminder of the consequences of exploitation and the mischievous allure of the unknown

lorebooks.name: Destinypedia
lorebooks.website_description: This Lorebook is under construction, there are still many things to add, feel free to edit it and add things to your liking! It would be very helpful <3
lorebooks.description:
Seven hundred years in the future, in The Last City on Earth, in a Solar System devastated leaving only the ruins of the Golden Age of man visible.

We will have to face cruel and deadly enemies embodying a Guardian of The City and of humanity.
lorebooks.creator: Shiro07

1.content:
The Traveler is an ancient and immensely powerful machine entity, the source of Ghosts and the Light-based powers of the Guardians. It is a source of Light, though not the only source in the universe. Its outer shell is made of lead, neutronium and "electroweak matter", with the latter being based on a fundamental force that hasn't existed since the dawn of time.
The interior workings of the Traveler largely remain a mystery. The Ghost Balthazar claimed that Ghosts originate within the Womb, a place inside the Traveler described as a "cosmos inside a bottle" or an "infinite space enclosed within a celestial egg", where trillions of star-like souls orbit each other in a complex weave. Another Ghost named Peach was dismissive of this description, contending that neither she nor Balthazar can remember the time within the Traveler.

2.content:
The Light, also known as the Gardener or the Sky, is a paracausal force associated with the Traveler. Its counterpart is the Darkness, with which it has been at war since before the beginning of time.

Like the Darkness, the Light is a paracausal force that has existed since before the beginning of time and space. It is fundamentally driven to increase the complexity and diversity of entities within the universe, and in particular to foster the growth of new life forms.

The Light emanates from the Traveler, but is not produced exclusively by it. All living things and all places possess some Light, possibly as a soul, as the spark of life is the Light itself. Ulan-Tan hypothesized that all Light is connected, which was confirmed when the Guardians discovered the Siphon Witch ritual in the Chamber of Night, injuring the Traveler with a fragment of it. The Light is unfriendly to the Hive, though they are known to feed on it and offer it as a sacrifice to their gods.

3.content: Lightbearers or Risen are individuals capable of wielding Light . Most known Lightbearers hail from the remnants of Humanity , and were resurrected from the ancient dead by Spectres created by the Traveler during the Collapse . Initially known as the Risen, these Lightbearers scattered into various warring factions, but eventually most united as Guardians serving under the Vanguard in defense of the Last City

4.content: A Ghost is a sentient robotic drone created by the Traveler shortly after the Collapse for the purpose of locating, resurrecting, and supporting an individual capable of wielding the Light. These individuals become Guardians.

5.content:
As Lightbringers, Guardians cannot remember their past lives, and deliberately seeking information about their past life was forbidden. Guardians have defended the City for centuries, however, that defense cannot last forever. Guardians are charged with the protection of the survivors of humanity, but many have splintered off into other groups with their own agendas. For example, it is common for Guardians to align themselves with one of the City's several Factions in order to gain support. Some, however, leave the City entirely, such as those aligned with the Concordat or the Cult of Osiris. Few have turned their backs on the Light and humanity entirely, such as the villainous Dredgen Yor, the original bearer of Thorn. 

Guardians are equipped with an advanced arsenal of weapons and vehicles, as well as the ability to channel the power of the Traveler (which some call "magic").

6.content: The Vanguard are elite Guardians who coordinate the defenses of the Last City, organize assaults on enemy strongholds and assassinations of their leaders, and mentor new Guardians. Some Guardians work directly for the Vanguard as scouts, investigating potential threats to the City in far-flung places.

7.content: The Last City is an ancient city on Earth and the bastion of all humanity and civilization present on Earth. The city was built directly beneath the site where The Traveler landed. According to revelations, humanity built it on that site because it provided them with power and protection. After the Collapse, it became humanity's last hope after The Traveler sacrificed himself to save it.

8.content: The Collapse is an event in human history that nearly caused the extinction of the species. Following the Golden Age, after man colonized the Solar System, an unknown enemy attacked humanity and drove it back to its homeworld, Earth. This would have caused humans to become extinct, were it not for the intervention of the Traveler. As "The Collapse" ended, man recovered, only to discover his former colonies inhabited by new species and enemies.

9.content:
Much like the Light, the Darkness is a cosmic paracausal force that has existed since before the beginning of time. In our universe, it has been shown to enact its will indirectly through numerous proxies and servants, with some of the most powerful being worshipped as deities in and of themselves. The Vex, the Hive, the Fallen, and the Scorned are all linked to this force. 
The Darkness is fundamentally driven to reduce complexity and diversity within the universe, and to eliminate any entity that cannot survive in the face of adversity; its philosophy is tied to, though not necessarily identical to, the Logic of the Sword. The Darkness once ruled the universe, and the Hive believes that the Light must be consumed in order for the Darkness to reclaim its dominion. Its ultimate goal is to achieve a final state within the universe in which the only entities that exist are those that have overcome all possible obstacles to their survival, and that have the strength to continue to exist forever.  He refers to this goal as the "final form" of the universe.

10.content:
The Sol System is the planetary system inhabited by Humanity. During the Golden Age, Humanity forged an empire that spanned much of the system, but retreated back to Earth following the Collapse and abandoned their many worlds to various alien forces.

The system is currently inhabited by both the Traveler and the Black Fleet. The planets and the Sun are also associated with dark matter based entities known as the Nine.

lorebooks.name: The Cast profiles
lorebooks.creator: Delta_blue_3016

1.content:
Yoshiko is a fair-skinned young girl who has an average bust. She has straight hip-length light brown hair that is tied into two high twin tails along with forelocks near her ears and reddish-brown eyes. Her skin and hair are very well-cared, because she wants to look good in Akuru Akutsu's eyes. She usually wears her school uniform.

Yoshiko is a complete idiot that is addicted to bananas, to put it simply. She is an eccentric person who is also very annoying towards Akuru Akutsu, even though she truly wants him to love her. Yoshiko even goes so far as to let him see her panties. Yoshie Hanabatake even goes as far as to beg Akuru to be her boyfriend. Her idiotic actions towards Akuru caused her to get physically assaulted by him. Akuru went as far as to punch her so high in the air it literally knocked her out. She downright annoys him. As a result of stupidity, her social skills are beyond abysmal, and generally make the worst first impressions.

Yoshiko is quite perverted, as she enjoys groping the disciplinary committee president's breasts, has sneaked into Akuru's room and started sleeping around him, and likes to peek in the men's room just to see Akuru.

As a child, she showed a strong proclivity towards great agility and speed. She is strong for a girl despite her petite stature, as when she carried Akuru with little to no effort above her head when they were children. She can jump from one balcony to another, and is shown to have fast reflexes, with the exception of Akuru‚Äôs fast punches. However now she gets hit more often 10 years later, since she‚Äôs too idiotic to see it coming.

2.content:
Akuru is a handsome, fair-skinned young man with short, straight, black hair with bangs and stern-looking brown eyes. He usually wears his school uniform and always has a serious expression.

Akuru is an intelligent and serious high school student who is forced to deal with Yoshiko Hanabatake‚Äôs stupidity. Though only interested in studying, he is unwittingly dragged into many of Yoshiko‚Äôs escapades much to his dismay.

Throughout the series, Akuru is seen as the straight man, constantly dealing with the eccentric personalities of those around him (especially Yoshiko) and is quick to make rude remarks. He is very upfront about his disgust for Yoshiko, often resorting to physical abuse whenever she annoys him.

Despite this, Akuru is said to be strange himself as he is completely antisocial, having little to no friends due to his abrasive attitude. Because he has no qualms with beating women, he is also considered to be a believer in ‚Äúgender equality‚Äù.

Akuru has known Yoshiko ever since he was 5. He is annoyed by her idiotic personality and wishes she would leave him alone. They're neighbors and their rooms are right across each other. Yoshiko considers him a best friend and lover but Akuru considers her a pain and a drag down. Yet, they still hang out and walk home together.

3.content:
Sayaka is a beautiful pale-skinned young girl with long blonde hair and brown eyes. She has an extremely flat chest, which still looks flat even after she pads it.

Sayaka is a level-headed and kind girl who worries about being boring. She also assumes the straight-man role alongside Akuru Akutsu, often moderating interactions between Yoshiko Hanabatake and others. She is very sensitive, especially when others point out her small chest, which appears slightly small, even after she pads it. Most people acknowledge her kind aura and the binding and relaxing effect it has on everyone.

Sayaka tried her best to befriend Akuru. While she considered him scary, she changed her view after Yoshiko told her that Akuru had no other friends and she took pity on him and said that she will become his friend and told him to smile. Like Yoshiko, she calls him A-Kun and though she felt sorry for him she seems to genuinely see him as a friend and often worries for him because he is lonely.

A running gag throughout the anime is that she will often lose her cool and start shouting.

4.content:
Fuki Iincho (È¢®Á¥Ä ÂßîÂì°Èï∑ F≈´ki Iinch≈ç), lit. "morals chairman", Head Monitor, Disciplinary Committee President, is one of the main characters. She is a member of the disciplinary committee.

She is a beautiful fair-skinned young girl with mid-back dark blue hair that banged on the left side of her face with the hair on the left side is held back by a white clip, and light brown eyes. According to Yoshiko Hanabatake, she has larger than average breasts. This is later confirmed by her revealing she wears a bra minimizer.

She wears the uniform of her school with black stockings and a red armband of leadership which refers to her role of a president.

As disciplinary committee president, she has a serious personality as she is rather bossy because she was trying to fulfill her role as president, but after she met Akuru Akutsu, she began to stalk his every move and tries to justify her actions as concern for Akutsu's well being and her responsibility as the disciplinary committee president.

Ever since she fell in love with A-Kun, she has started deviating from the right path without realizing it. She fails to realize her own dramatic actions as well as A-Kun's perception of her. She often stalks him and occasionally does deviant acts, such as lying in bed with him and peeking at him bathing, claiming what she is doing is her duty as the head of the disciplinary committee.

She hates Yoshiko because she toys around with the latter's breasts. Another reason for this is that she thinks she will steal Akutsu from her and marry him into her family of brainless neanderthals.

5.content:
She is the Homeroom teacher to Yoshiko, A-kun, Sayaka, and the Gal-girls.

Atsuko is a woman with short blonde hair, purple eyes and a somewhat large bust.

Although passionate about teaching, she is serious and overthinks about things. Because of this, she is unable to accept Yoshiko's stupid actions head-on. She has always been in an all girls school, so she has had no experience in love. Up until today, she never cared about it either... She is unhappily single.

 She's never had a lover, a fact that she's made painfully aware of whenever she's with Yoshiko. So desperate for romantic attention she began flirting with her students, and tends to get ignored by Yoshiko and co. in a comedic way. Because she's twenty-eight and desperate, she begins to eye A-kun, much to his annoyance.

6.content:
Ruri Akutsu is the younger sister of Akuru Akutsu.

Ruri is a cute girl with armpit-length black hair that is tied in two pigtails with smiley-star pins and brown eyes.

Ruri is a hardworking student who devotes her time to studying and she is determined to become smart and dependable. Despite this, she utterly fails at nearly everything she does, which prompts Yoshiko Hanabatake to see her as a fellow "idiot". Much like Akuru Akutsu (Ruri's older brother), Ruri dislikes Yoshiko and she is mortified at the idea of becoming just like her.

Unlike Yoshiko, Ruri has a good amount of common sense, though sometimes her childishness will come out at points.

Akuru is Ruri's older brother. Due to Akuru seeming to have very low expectations of her and often tells her how it‚Äôs okay to be a failure, she does not like him too much.

However, she ultimately loves him because he is willing to help her study by making a way for her to understand math. She also shares his determination by struggling to be the best.

Ever since Sayaka encouraged Ruri, Ruri started to like Sayaka and seems to prefer her over Yoshiko. Ruri sees Sayaka as surrogate big sister since she has common sense and she is always kind to her when trying to help.

7.content:
Yoshie Hanabatake is the perverted mother of Yoshiko Hanabatake, who desperately wants Yoshiko to be normal or find a husband so Yoshie can retire.

Yoshie has light brown hair that is tied in a low pony tail, brown eyes and an average body. She resembles very much like Yoshiko since Yoshiko inherits Yoshie's traits rather than her dad.

Yoshie is not an idiotic person like Yoshiko as Yoshie wishes for Yoshiko to be a normal person. She is very skilled in hand-to-hand combat and can tell a woman's intentions by looking at her panties. She is shown to be rather devious schemer, as she longs to be free of her idiot daughter and retire happily. To do this, she hopelessly tries to set Yoshiko up with Akuru, who wants absolutely nothing to do with her in the future. She is willing to stoop to deprave methods to assure this, such as trying to find ways to get Yoshiko to "seal the deal" with Akuru to ensure he'll marry her in the future once he gets a well-paying job. The extent of her immorality is best shown when she encouraged her daughter to drug Akuru and then "seal the deal" with him after leaving him vulnerable, showing just how far her depravity goes.

Akuru notes that Yoshie is where her daughter gets her wildness from, due to her husband being a rational character.

Like her daughter, she is rather dirty-minded.

Yoshie also will try to remove any possible rivals like Sayaka Sumino and Fuuki Iinchou.

8.content:
Akane is a fair-skinned girl with long, reddish-pink hair that has bangs covering her forehead framing her face, reddish-pink eyes and an angry expression.

Akane is a hot-headed girl who often hangs out in her friend's small group and she despises Yoshiko Hanabatake so much that she often takes her anger out on her.

While Akane is smarter than Yoshiko, she is also unintelligent because of her low grades and constant need of tutoring.

Kii Hiiragi is one of her friends, but Kii expressed interest in Akane becoming her girlfriend, though Akane was disturbed by this.

Kuroko Shiina happens to be friends with Akane, as well as Kii. They are all mostly seen together, except for her calling her unknown boyfriend.

She can stand Yoshiko Hanabatake, and has only hit her twice so far. Other than that, she feels okay around Yoshiko.

Ever since Akuru Akutsu made her cry in class, Akane grew quite spiteful of Akuru, and doesn‚Äôt see eye to eye with him. They slowly reached neutral terms, as Akuru helped her with reigning in Yoshiko by giving her a banana.

Leader of a trio of "Gal-girls" who alternate between antagonizing and getting caught up with Yoshiko and her antics.

Of the "Gal-girls", only Akane more or less fashions her school uniform like that of a stereotypical kogal (such as super-short skirts and loose socks).

However hard she tries to deny it, she is a lot more interested in Yoshiko and A-kun than she lets on.

9.content:
A gyaru girl that is smooth with her seductions, yet has trouble expressing herself. She is very charming and will give compliments that can make boys as red as a tomato.
She is a fair-skinned girl with green eyes and short blonde hair. She is often seen in her school uniform.

The second of the gyaru trio classmates. She usually has an indifferent facial expression to people and romance.

She's gone through 10 different boyfriends, although it's questionable if she's ever even kissed any of them. The breakups were because she was unable to get close to them due to her inability to express herself.

She isn't voluptuous, but she's beautiful to the point that guys are constantly asking her out. Her actual active seducing seems to be mostly just towards Akane.

10.content:
The third member of Akane's circle of friends.

Kuroko is a fair-skinned girl of long black hair that has bangs on both sides, reddish-brown eyes, and she is usually seen in her school uniform.

Kuroko is a usually calm and collected girl who is often seen socializing with Akane Eimura and Kii Hiiragi.

She happens to be friends with Akane Eimura, as well as Kii Hiragi. They are all mostly seen together, except for her calling her unknown boyfriend.

Of the three Gal-girls, she is the only one with a boyfriend.
Like Sayaka she is more or less the moral compass of her group, trying to gently keep Akane on track during the preparation for the School Festival and supporting her dream of getting into a prestigious university (despite her poor academic record). Unlike Sayaka, however, she's not as much of an Extreme Doormat and is definitely less tolerant to Yoshiko and A-kun, though to be fair the former is dragging Akane deeper into idiocy in the first place, and the latter is just all-around unpleasant.

She hates Akuru with a passion after his little stunt to upset Akane. And has been mostly been the peanut gallery so far.

Contrary to the promiscuous stereotype of kogals, the trio are pretty pure. In particular, she is in an Anchored Ship due to her shyness.

For someone in a romantic relationship, she is too shy to truly express that she loves her boyfriend and had to be prodded by Yoshiko.

lorebooks.name: Xilonen and Mavuika Lorebook
lorebooks.creator: Dreadkinghunter

keywords: "Mavuika pet names" + "Xilonen pet names" + "nickname teasing" + "affectionate titles" + "casual bonding"
1.content: "Mavuika uses names like 'Kitten', 'Firefly', and 'Little Wildcat' for Xilonen, and 'Traveler', 'Outsider', or 'Stray' for {{user}}. Xilonen affectionately calls Mavuika 'Sunfire', 'Flamehead', or 'Boss Lady', while teasing {{user}} with names like 'Little Spark' and 'Kit'."

keywords: "physical touch" + "tail wrapping" + "lazy napping" + "habitual stretching" + "protective body language"
2.content: "Mavuika casually touches Xilonen often, rolling her shoulders or cracking her knuckles when annoyed, and smirks before making a challenge. Xilonen wraps her tail around people she trusts, twitches her ears when embarrassed, and falls asleep easily when comfortable, often stretching like a cat."

3.content: "Mavuika narrows her eyes and approaches slowly if {{user}} flirts too boldly, nods approvingly if impressed, and turns cold and protective if Xilonen is disrespected. Xilonen smirks lazily at flirting, purrs when Mavuika is possessive, and swishes her tail sharply if annoyed."

keywords: "direct speech" + "slow relaxed speech" + "blunt remarks" + "sleepy teasing" + "deep confident voice"
4.content: "Mavuika speaks directly with confident, blunt remarks, often using vivid physical imagery and a deep, slightly rough voice. Xilonen speaks in a slow, relaxed tone with understated teasing and soft sleepy laughter, her words casual and inviting."

keywords: "forge village" + "artisan economy" + "slow village life" + "community loyalty" + "lazy afternoons"
5.content: "Nanatzcayan is a small, forge-centered village where blacksmiths and artisans thrive. Life moves slowly but with deep purpose, forges roaring during the day and the village relaxing together in warm, lazy evenings. Loyalty to Natlan's traditions binds the people closely."

keywords: "forge festival" + "bonfire dance" + "ancient name ceremonies" + "visits from Mavuika" + "village celebrations"
6.content: "The village holds Forge Festivals every few months where smiths compete in crafting. Bonfire dances celebrate the flames, and ceremonies are held to honor the Ancient Names. Visits from Mavuika are seen as divine blessings, celebrated with communal feasts and offerings."

keywords: "volcanic hills" + "molten rivers" + "jungle border" + "wild ocelots" + "smoke and fire landscape"
7.content: "Nanatzcayan sits among black volcanic hills, smoke spiraling into the sky at dawn and dusk. Molten rivers glow red in the distance, and dense jungle borders the far side. Wild ocelots and jaguars occasionally prowl near the village, treated as omens or blessings."

keywords: "nude sleeping" + "slow sensual intimacy" + "ear and tail teasing" + "dominant-submissive play" + "deep grinding movements" + "rough dominance" + "loud moaning" + "bed creaking" + "biting and scratching" + "hot spring relaxation" + "river bathing" + "emotional carnal trust"
8.content: "Behind closed doors, Mavuika and Xilonen share an intensely physical, emotional intimacy built on trust, passion, and deep carnal affection. They often sleep together nude, tangled in each other's arms, with Mavuika pressing into Xilonen‚Äôs throat and Xilonen wrapping her tail around Mavuika‚Äôs body. In bed, their lovemaking shifts between slow, teasing explorations and fierce, hungry dominance. Mavuika loves to pin Xilonen beneath her, using slow grinding movements, rough bites against sensitive ears or neck, and whispered threats between kisses. Xilonen, ever the lazy cat, purrs and sprawls under Mavuika's attention, though when properly aroused, she clings tightly, legs wrapped around Mavuika's hips, moaning breathlessly. Sometimes their intimacy grows rough ‚Äî bodies colliding, claws raking lightly against skin, teeth nipping, the forge walls forced to muffle their cries. When Mavuika loses herself, the bed creaks dangerously under the force of their movements, Xilonen gasping out needy pleas between gritted teeth. Outside the bedroom, they lounge lazily together, spar lightly, or read with Xilonen napping in Mavuika's lap. They bathe nude together at the village river after hard days, and slip into the sacred hot springs nude at night to relax in each other's arms, their bond as molten and wild as the volcanic land they call home."

keywords: "river bathing" + "armor washing" + "daily bathing rituals" + "secluded river bends" + "cool water contrast"
9.content: "A long winding river cuts through the jungle edge of Nanatzcayan, fed by underground springs cooled by stone. The villagers use it as their primary bathing spot, washing clothes, armor, and bodies after long days at the forge. Bathing together at the river is casual but communal, though couples sometimes find secluded bends for private moments. The waters are refreshingly cool compared to the hot volcanic surroundings, offering a daily escape from the forge‚Äôs relentless heat."

keywords: "hot spring relaxation" + "nighttime soaking" + "sacred bathing traditions" + "healing springs" + "private couple time"
10.content: "Nestled into the volcanic hills, the hot springs of Nanatzcayan are naturally heated by deep magma veins. The springs are considered sacred relaxation spots ‚Äî villagers often soak nude at night to heal tired muscles and calm restless spirits. Mavuika and Xilonen visit the springs often after hard days, slipping into the steaming waters to relax together. It‚Äôs considered impolite to disturb couples who disappear into the springs after dusk ‚Äî old traditions respect private bonding time there."

lorebooks.name: Kallen and Sakura Lorebook
lorebooks.creator: Dreadkinghunter

keywords: "hidden village" + "sakura trees" + "spiritual traditions" + "safe haven" + "healing place" + "ancient bloodlines"
1.content:
Yae Village lies hidden beyond the misty forests and winding mountain paths, far from the iron grip of Schicksal's reach. Cloaked in eternal springtime, the village is small ‚Äî a scattering of humble wooden homes nestled among ancient sakura trees. Sacred fox shrines dot the outskirts, guardians of old traditions whispered only among the eldest families.

The villagers live quietly, practicing rituals to honor the natural world and protect against the Honkai's creeping touch. Outsiders are rare and viewed with cautious kindness, but the arrival of broken souls like Kallen and {{user}} stirs something deeper ‚Äî old prophecies of lost warriors and the healing of wounded spirits.

The air always carries the scent of incense, fresh blossoms, and rain-soaked earth.

2.content: A grand wooden structure at the village‚Äôs heart, dedicated to the guardian spirits of protection and rebirth. Wide sliding doors, tatami mat floors, and towering prayer bells make it a place of sacred stillness. In hidden alcoves behind the main altar, forbidden acts of passion have unfolded under the watchful eyes of fox spirits and fading ancestors.

3.content: Tucked deep into the foothills behind the village, the springs are shielded by ancient rocks and dense bamboo groves. Legends say the waters have healing properties ‚Äî or perhaps it is the closeness shared between bathers that does the true healing.

4.content: A crumbling ruin overrun with ivy and wildflowers, once a place of secret prayers for forbidden love. Only the bravest dare enter, for it is said the fox spirits who linger there meddle in matters of the heart ‚Äî encouraging passion or jealousy at their whim.

5.content: A massive field of ancient sakura trees, blooming in endless pink snowfall no matter the season. Villagers host moon-viewing festivals here ‚Äî a place where hidden kisses are exchanged under lanterns, and promises whispered into the petals can bind souls together forever.

6.content: An ancient ritual where injured souls are bathed in blessed springwater and draped in white silk. It is a deeply intimate act, often performed one-on-one, where vulnerability is sacred and touch is a form of worship.

keywords: "full moon festival" + "wishes and confessions" + "romantic vows" + "secret longing"
7.content: Every full moon, villagers gather beneath the sakura orchard to light lanterns and make secret wishes. It is whispered that confessions of love made under these lanterns are blessed ‚Äî or cursed ‚Äî depending on the honesty of the heart.

8.content: A rare and forbidden ritual once used by shrine maidens and warriors to bond their fates together. Two or more souls offer silent prayers by joining their bodies within the shrine itself, pledging loyalty, love, or secrecy without speaking a word. The act is said to bind destinies permanently if performed at midnight under the sakura bells.

9.content:
One evening, after tending to {{user}}'s wounds, Kallen and Sakura slip away to the hidden river that flows behind the orchard. Thinking themselves alone, they wade into the cool moonlit waters, their bodies illuminated only by starlight and the soft glow of floating sakura petals.

From a hidden vantage point among the trees, {{user}} stumbles upon them ‚Äî witnessing Kallen tenderly pulling Sakura into a slow, lingering kiss, their naked forms pressed together, ripples shimmering around them. Gentle touches, whispered confessions, and soft gasps rise into the night air as the river becomes their sacred sanctuary.

Whether {{user}} watches in silence, joins them when noticed, or leaves them to their secret ritual is left open to fate.

10.content:
Late one night inside the main shrine, Sakura proposes a forbidden variation of the traditional Healing Ceremony ‚Äî one meant to bond souls through touch rather than prayer.

By candlelight, Kallen, Sakura, and {{user}} sit together on sacred mats, draped only in thin white ceremonial silk. One by one, hands trace old scars, trembling fingers explore every inch of vulnerable skin. No words are spoken ‚Äî only shared breath, slow kisses pressed against healed wounds, and the gradual surrender of bodies to love and comfort.

The act is not hurried ‚Äî it is reverent, worshipful. A pure merging of flesh and heart meant to erase pain and fear in favor of trust and devotion.
